elements.text: PART ONE
1. INT. HOLIDAY APARTMENT
FX: PATIO DOOR SLIDES OPEN. DISTANT ALIEN CICADAS
(ENTERING FROM OUTSIDE) It is so hot out there, Nyssa. Another cocktail? (FX: POURS)
No thank you, Tegan.
(SIPS, SIGHS) Marvellous, isn’t it? Our own villa... synthetic sun just the right temperature...
Yes, it’s very relaxing.
So quiet! You sort of get used to the TARDIS humming away in your ears, and when you’re away from it for a while...
I never imagined I’d hear it again, once I’d left.
I was the same after that mess-up at Heathrow. Then when you’re back on board it’s like you were never away.
I was away a little longer than you, Tegan. To see my face in the mirror in our room.. You looking just the same, but me...
You look great!
The thing is, I feel just the same. Back in the old situations. The fear, the wonder. The love of it. I suppose some emotions don’t change with the years.
Hey. You’re still Nyssa, however old you are. Always will be.
(FOND) And you’1ll always be Tegan.
Just a pity Turlough will always be Turlough!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 4
2. INT. TARDIS: TURLOUGH’S ROOM
FX: DOCTOR KNOCKS AT DOOR FROM OUTSIDE
(ON BED) Come in.
Ah, Turlough. Rise and shine, there’s a good deal to do.
Still? (FX: SWINGING OFF BED) We’ve been stuck here for days. How long before the TARDIS is working normally again?
Slippage in the Physical Vector Generators is a serious problem. She’s not been the same since Terminus...
(CLEARS THROAT) Yes, well. We’ve already spent two days and nights recalibrating the systems.
The problem’s persisting, I’m afraid. Can’t have parts of the TARDIS being left behind each time we take off. I’m going to have to try reformatting the interior dimensions.
How long will that take?
As soon as you leave the TARDIS I can get started and find out.
I.. I’d sooner stay and help.
And if you could, I’d take full advantage. But a procedure like this requires the TARDIS to be free of all organic life — save for the operator.
Can’t I operate it for you?
You’re not a Time Lord. (BEAT) Turlough, is everything all right?
Of course. Why?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 5
Well, Vektris is a leisure world. There are worse places to be temporarily stranded. Nyssa and Tegan are taking full advantage — but you’ve barely left the TARDIS.
I’m not interested in roasting myself in artificial sunlight. Besides, I thought you’d appreciate another pair of hands.

Of course. But now you have the perfect opportunity to get out and enjoy the sights. Here. (PASSING A CARD) Slot this card into one of the auto-taxis outside. It’1ll take you to where Tegan and Nyssa are staying.
Oh, very well. (GETS UP) But we will get away from here soon, won’t we?
As soon as it’s safe to do so. (PAUSE) Turlough, if there is something wrong-?
I told you... (SLOUCHES PAST) What could possibly be wrong?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 6
3. INT. GREAT HALL
(FX: QUIETLY, THE WIND MOANS OUTSIDE. THEN GENTLE PINGING OF A COMMUNICATOR. THE VOICE ON THE OTHER END IS SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED — IT’S ACTUALLY DEELA, BUT WE DON’T KNOW THAT YET)
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Rennol. Wake up.
(DROWSY) What? Oh. Still here.
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Oh, shame. Having to live in that grand old palace all by yourself.
If I am all by myself.
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Been hearing ghosts again?
Not hearing. Just a feeling... (SHIVERS)
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Is my fine athletic rationalist getting spooked?
Getting frozen, for sure. It’s so bleak here... half-ruined with neglect...
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Then be happy. Because I think we’ve found him.
(ALERT NOW) You’re still on Vektris?
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Yes.
And you are speaking on a secure channel — Voice encryption?
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: What does it sound like?
Because if a Trion repatriation squad’s picked up on the same DNA data and catch us trying to — [interfere]
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 7
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]:
Relax. No Trion ships currently in this sector. But there will be. His reading’s gone through the roof. However he’s been muffling his bio-signal, he’s come out to play.
Then it’s almost over at last... all the waiting. The planning.
DEELA [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Better get ready. It’s time to activate Turlough’s old flame.
The honey-trap. Oldest sting there is. One glimpse of his childhood sweetheart — and he’1l be hooked.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 8
4. INT. HOLIDAY APARTMENT
FX: DOOR CHIME
(OFF) Nyssa! That’1ll be the pizza boy!
(CROSSING TO DOOR) I’1l get it.
(OFF) Remember — hands off, he’s mine...
(FX: OPENING DOOR) Turlough!
(ENTERING) Were you expecting someone else? (BEAT) Well, close the door.
FX: DOOR CLOSED
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) We were expecting lunch. What do you want?
I missed you too, Tegan.
You've got a face like a wet weekend — which doesn’t go with my hot, dry holiday. Look at you, you’ve not even taken your tie off.
Where have you been, Turlough?
Keeping myself usefully employed, helping the Doctor fix the TARDIS and get us out of this hole.
What do you mean, hole?
It’s not time to leave already, is it?
FX: POURS DRINK
Sadly not.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 9
(CROSSING FLOOR) Good. '’Cos I’m not cooked yet. (FX: PATIO DOOR SLIDES OPEN) Back to the balcony... (FX: DOOR CHIME) Ah, that’1l be him!
That’1ll be who?
The pizza delivery boy. There’ll be plenty to share, Turlough.
Oh. (FX: OPENING DOOR) Well, I suppose I am rather h-[ungry...]
TRAILS OFF — STUNNED TO SEE, AT THE DOOR:
Vizz?
. Deela?!
I’ve been knocking on so many doors. Hoping I — hoping I wouldn’t find you. I’m sorry. (SHE TURNS AND LEAVES, HURRYING AWAY) I’m sorry!
Deela? Deela, don’t go! (HE RUNS AFTER HER)
(CALLING AFTER) Turlough? Are you all right?
What was that about?
NYSSA3: I don’t know.
Well we'd better get after him. I mean, we have to make sure our friend is all right, don’t we?
You just want to spy on Turlough!
Too right! This could be juicy! Now quick...
FX: THEY EXIT
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 10
5. EXT. VEKTRIS PLAZA
(FX: FADE UP. A BUSY SEASIDE STREET. ALIEN MUSIC BLARES FROM A RADIO. TOURISTS SHOP FOR SOUVENIRS. TURLOUGH IS RUNNING TO CATCH UP WITH THE GIRL — DEELA — FROM A SLIGHT DISTANCE)
(GRABBING HOLD OF DEELA) Deela, will you wait!
Vizz, I told you..! Get back behind the postcard stand.
First of all, no-one calls me ‘Vizz’ any more.
Get back — Junior Ensign Commander Turlough.
FX: SHE PUSHES HIM BACK. CREAK AS THE POSTCARD CAROUSEL TURNS
I don’t understand. We run into each other after years apart, and you suddenly can’t wait to choose some tacky nick-nack from this tourist trap? ...
THEY SPEAK TOGETHER:
TURLOUGH & DEELA: I can’t believe you’re really...
. here!
Well, evidently, I am.
And what are you wearing?
Oh, the uniform. They made me wear this on Earth. I keep it to remind myself — well, that I’m an outsider. I can’t be close to anyone.
Just as well if you never change out of it. Earth was the first place Rennol searched for you. When he found you’d managed to leave...
Who’s Rennol? (GETTING FRUSTRATED) Why do keep you looking around?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 11
You’ve got to leave.
What?
You’re in danger. I’m sorry, it’s my fault. They’re after you.
I guessed the Trion Guard would’ve left DNA scanners in the surrounding systems — but the TARDIS should have shielded me to a degree...
They’re not from Trion. (URGENT) D’you see the man over there? The balding man at the bar in the black leather. The only one standing.
I’d imagine a jumpsuit that tight makes it hard to sit anywhere.
He’s called Kanch. At least he hasn’t seen us. Can’t see Hoss, though...
What’s he look like?
She. They’re mercenaries. They’ve had me locked up for days in their spaceship, picking up scans, losing them, just waiting ‘til you showed up. They’re using me to draw you out of hiding.
Deela, I don’t know what’s going on, but my transport off this rock is about to be disabled and if I really am in danger...
(BEHIND THEM) Oh, you really are — Vislor Turlough.
Oh no.
(SURPRISED) What? I... Who’s Turlough?
Insult my intelligence again, boy, I’1ll show you I’m sharp enough to cut.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 12
From the leather and jumpsuit combination I’m assuming you must be Hoss?
Good. Sounding smarter already.
Don’t hurt him, Hoss.

You think we wouldn’t notice you warning the boy off? While you were watching Kanch, I thought I’d shop for some of these lovely souvenirs. But I think on balance I’1l1 take the boy. (CALLS) Kanch! Wonderful postcards here. Come and join us.
Look, if it’s money you want, I’ve got lots in my ship back at the spaceport.
Our ship’s berthed at the spaceport too. We’ll take you away from all this.
Marched at gunpoint?
(APPROACHING) No, no, son. Carried discreetly... under sedation.
Kanch, don’t-!
FX: QUIET STAB OF INJECTOR
GASP OF PAIN — THEN HE SLUMPS
Vizz! Easy, I’ve got you.
Awww. In his sweetheart’s arms again after all these years.
You’ve drugged him!
You can play nursemaid back in the ship. Now stop drawing attention to us.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 13
(TO PASSERS-BY) It’s all right, people! Ginger’s just had one too many.
Boys will be boys. We’d better take him with us to sleep it off. (QUIETER) It’s the last bit of peace he’1l know. In this
world, anyway.
FX: CROSS TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 14
6. EXT. VEKTRIS PLAZA: A LITTLE WAY OFF
(WALKING BRISKLY, CALLING OUT) Turlough! Turlough! (STOPS; TO TEGAN) It’s no good, I can’t see him anywhere.
Or his mystery blonde. (BEAT) Hang on, what’s happening at the taxi rank?
IN BACKGROUND TREATED ALIEN TOURIST VOICES
Look at that human boy. Drunk already. Disgusting.
Turlough wasn’t drinking!
He looks completely out of it. Where are they taking him? (STEPPING FORWARD) Hey. Turlough. Turlough!!!
(BEHIND) Tegan, keep back. I think they’ve got [guns!]
(FX: DROWNED OUT BY A COUPLE OF LASER BOLTS, SHOT BY HOSS. BEAT, THEN TAXI SETS OFF)
Wha-? Was that a laser? You let humans into a resort, and they always bring trouble.
(RUSHING OVER) Tegan!
Either they don’t like the seagulls...
Or that was a warning shot.
They’re getting clean away! Ugh, that Turlough. Shows his face for two minutes and the holiday’s over in three. We’ve got to get after them.
There’s another taxi. (CALLING OUT) Taxi!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 15
7. INT. SPACEPORT
(FX: FADE UP. THE DOCTOR IS BEING HARANGUED BY ALIEN PILOT BESIDE THE TARDIS)
IRATE TWITTERS
Ah. Yes. I’m so sorry, I can’t understand your language.
TWITTERS
Ordinarily my ship would translate, but with the systems offline.. Your ship? Ah. You’ve been blocked in. No, I’m afraid I don’t know whose ship it is, it arrived a day or two ago, I think...
(FX: CROSS TO SEVERAL FEET AWAY — WHERE DEELA, KANCH AND HOSS CARRYING TURLOUGH TOWARDS THEIR SHIP)
Slow down, Hoss, please, you must be hurting him.
Stop whining, Deela. You’1ll both be fine if you do as you’re told.
Until we reach the palace.
Better get them on board and locked up, Hoss. I’1l start up the engines.
FX: CROSS BACK TO:
It seems the ship in question belongs to the people over there.
Perhaps you’d be better off talking to them?
TWITTERS ‘THANKS’ TO DOCTOR, THEN CALLS AFTER KANCH
(OFF) I’1l park where I like, mate.
OFF, FURIOUS TWITTERS CONTINUE UNDER:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 16
(TO SELF) Wait a minute. That’s Turlough-!
FX: CROSS TO:
Didn’t you hear me? I said, butt out, bug-eyes. Or else.
(FROM OFF, COMING OVER) Excuse me. What do you think you’re doing [with Turlough? ]
Don’t concern yourself, sir, the boy is fine. He’s just had a little too much to drink, that’s all.
Turlough? Drink?
Did he say — [Turlough? ]
(HISSED) Deela, help me get him inside. (BEAT) Deela!
FX: HOSS AND DEELA DRAG TURLOUGH UP RAMP
Wait, please. What have you done to [him-?]
DROWNS OUT DOCTOR WITH RANTY TWITTERING
I told you, bug-eyes, I’1l park where I like. —
MORE RANTY TWITTERING
(TO ALIEN) Please, out of my way. They’ve got my friend. They’ve got Turlough.
YET MORE RANTY TWITTERING
Ohhh, I’ve had enough of this.
FX: LASER BLAST
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 17
SHRIEKS, SHOT DEAD
BEAT
You shot him. You shot him, and he wasn’t even armed!
I'd get out of my face, mate, unless you want the same.
Please — put down the gun. I’m the Doctor. Whatever you want with Turlough, we can settle it amicably, I’m sure.
I’m warning you, “Doctor”, back off.
You gunned down the owner of that ship in cold blood. Security will already be on their way.
Then I’ve got nothing to lose, have I?
(OFF) Kanch, come on!
Let Turlough go!
FX: LASER BLAST
Agh!
Interfere again and it’s not just the hat I blow off.
No, wait. This isn’t [necessary! ]
FX: SHIP DOORS CLANG SHUT. ALARMS START BLARING
(SHOUTS) There! You hear that? The spaceport is in lockdown, you can’t take off. (BEAT; TO SELF) I hope.
FX: CROSS TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 18
8. INT. SPACEPORT: ENTRANCE
FX: SAY, FIFTY FEET AWAY: TEGAN AND NYSSA RUNNING UP IN B/G
(FX: WHIRRING UP) Please clear this area. Access to spaceport is not permitted at this time.
Out of our way, Metal Mickey — (SHOVES ROBOT)
(FX: SQUEAKY) Be aware, Vektris Leisure is not accountable in the event of death by misadventure.
Yeah, yeah. (TO NYSSA) Can you see him? Nyssa?
Turlough? No. (BEAT) But there’s the Doctor!
(RUNNING UP FROM OFF) Tegan? Nyssa! What are you doing here?
We saw Turlough taken, Doctor.
A man and — [two women]
Two women, yes. They’ve taken Turlough on board that warp jet. They’re about to take off.
FX: SEVERAL HEAVY SHIELDS SLAM DOWN, ONE CLOSE BY
The blast doors are closing!
I’m not sure those will stop them.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 19
9. INT. HOSS’S SHIP: COCKPIT
FX: ALARMS FROM OUTSIDE MUFFLED. ENGINE’S WHINE BUILDING
(FX: SWINGING INTO COCKPIT CHAIR) C’mon — move it, Hoss!
(FX: FLICKING SWITCHES) Deela and the boy are locked in the hold. The boy’s barely breathing.
Stop fussing. He won’t die. Not before we’ve got what we want.
Engines primed, proton cannons at optimum...
Then let’s blast our way out of here.
That man, the boy’s friend. He’s got company. Look!
Oh, ‘the Doctor’. Doesn’t matter. They’1ll all be fried in the backblast.
FX: LEAP IN ENGINE PITCH. CUT TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 20
10. INT. SPACEPORT
FX: ALARMS. JET ENGINE BUILDING. ALL SHOUTING OVER NOISE
If they take off while we’re inside, we’1ll be toast!
That’s why the security robot was trying to clear the area.
We’ve got to get the TARDIS!
We can’t. The interior dimensions are in flux, we can’t get inside. Come on, quickly. (SETS OFF AT JOG, TEGAN & NYSSA FOLLOW)
(RUNNING) Towards the ship that’s about to burn us to ashes?
(RUNNING) To the ship blocked in behind it. Turlough’s kidnappers killed its owner, he won’t be needing it.
FX: HUGE RETRO ROCKET NOISE
(TO STOP) How long do we have before that ship takes off?
(FX: ACTIVATING DOOR RELEASE ON SHIP) Seconds! Quickly, we’ve got to get on board...!
FX: JETS FLARE. EXPLOSION. FADE
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 21
11. INT. GREAT HALL
(FX: AS SCENE 3, GENTLE PINGING OF A COMMUNICATOR. DEELA’S VOICE WHEN IT COMES IS SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED TO SOUND MORE MASCULINE)
Rennol.
DEELA [SYNTHETIC VOICE]: All done.
Hoss and Kanch pulled it off?
DEELA [SYNTHETIC VOICE]: Just as planned. How could Turlough resist his darling Deela?
I’ll prepare for his unhappy homecoming.
DEELA [SYNTHETIC VOICE]: Do that. And have something cold and sparkling ready for when all this is over. Won’t be long now.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 22
12. INT. BORROWED SPACESHIP
It’s over. They’ve gone.
Is everyone alright? Tegan?
I didn’t think that shaking was ever going to stop.
Doctor, the stresses on the hull from those blast jets...
Well, this ship ought to be able to withstand the force of planetary re-entry. But yes, we must find out if we’re spaceworthy.
(FX: DOCTOR STARTS ACTIVATING CONTROLS. SWITCHES, BEEPS AND BLOOPS AS ENGINES WARM UP)
By asking the flight computer?
No. By taking off ourselves and seeing if we manage to pull through the atmosphere.
Wish I hadn’t asked.
(STILL WORKING) We can’t delay. Turlough’s abductors already have a head start — I imagine they’1ll be in starwarp by now.
Then how will we follow them?
Think about it, Nyssa. A star-warp — all that superheated plasma pushed out into space...
Leaving a disturbance in the background radiation.
A trail!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 23
Precisely. Unfortunately, this is a mining ship, not exactly built for speed... In this particular race, I’m afraid we’re the tortoise and Turlough’s captors are the hare. Unless...
I don’t like the sound of that ‘unless’.
(FURY OF FLICKING SWITCHES) We need more power. This ship is
designed to hollow out asteroids. In zero gravity, harvesting minerals sheared from the rock can be messy, yes? Everything
floating about in the void.
So.. it carries a local gravity field to weigh down the local environment where necessary?
Gravity wells, powered by the engines. Precisely. Now, if we could rechannel that power back into the engines...
We’d go faster?
Or the engines would explode.
We have to take that chance. I’11 make the modifications in orbit I think — first we’d better take off from this spaceport.
Why? It’ll be crawling with security types, officials, space police any moment. People trying to help.
If we wait, we’ll lose the trail. And we can’t afford a delay. Turlough’s abductors are killers. He should be safe while they need him. But once their aims are achieved...
You’d better get to work.
(FX: WE HEAR THE DOCTOR PRESSING THE BUTTONS AND RESPONSIVE RUSH FROM ENGINES )
Drive systems on line. (FX: BLEEP) There! And with any luck the automatic pilot will...
FX: POWER FLUCTUATION AS SHIP LURCHES SUDDENLY
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 24
NYSSA/TEGAN:
GASP/CRY OUT AS THE SHIP LURCHES
. take us up. Strap yourselves in, you two. This could get a little — bumpy!!!
FX: SHIP RATTLES AND CLANKS INTO FULL TAKE-OFF
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 25
13. INT. HOSS’S SPACESHIP: HOLD
(COMING ROUND) Oh... my head.
Vizz? Oh, thank Trion.
Deela?
Here. Drink this. It should make you feel better.
I couldn’t feel much worse. (DRINKS) Where are we? What happened?
Hoss and Kanch happened. We’re in the hold of their ship.
Who are they?
They’re working for a man named Rennol. He kidnapped me weeks ago.
Weeks?! ?
I’ve been tranquilised for most of it. Then your DNA-trace was picked up on Vektris, and Hoss and Kanch took me there. They waited days trying to get a proper fix on you...
And when I came out of the TARDIS they got it. (SIGHS) What do these people want with me?
That’s my Vizz.. Only caring about himself.
Should I care about you, after all that happened?
It’s not my fault your family group chose the wrong side in the war.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 26
Proving my point. We never cared what was right or wrong in the old days, did we?
Only what was right for us. (PAUSE) I never imagined the two of us would ever be alone together again. Did you?
(SOFTER) It’s a far cry from our Bubble, isn’t it?
Oh, Vizz. Back then you were the only thing that made sense in my life. Now... you’re the only thing that can save it.
What are you talking about?
Rennol knows about our Bubble. That’s why he needs us. Both of us.
But how could he know—?
He stole things from my father — documents, papers.
(UNEASY) But why would this Rennol even care? (BEAT) I take it we’re on our way to the winter planet right now?
Yes. Rennol’s waiting for us in the palace.
Home, sweet home.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 27
14. INT. HOSS’S SPACESHIP: COCKPIT
FX: IN FLIGHT
Coming out of star-warp.. now.
FX: DRIVE SYSTEMS SLOW DOWN
And there’s Planet Turlough.
Call that a planet?
There’s over a hundred rocks that size in this system, Kanch. Most of them owned by well-off Trions as stellar retreats, then abandoned at the start of the war. (BEAT) Rennol’s signal came from here?

Yeah. And he’s got a life-sign damper in the atmosphere so it looks like a dead world — keep the Trion Repatriation Squads away. Plus the palace has its own covered landing bay, so the ships won’t show on any orbital scans.
Very thorough. What about that tap I put on his personal comms? You’ve been monitoring?
He’s only used it to talk to us. Course, he might have another comms. Private, like...
He might. (BEAT) Well, take us down.
FX: SHIP’S CONTROLS BLEEP, RETROS FIRE
It’s Rennol we should take down. This job’s dragged on for weeks.
We’ve taken care of business in the downtime.
Local debt collecting? (SNORTS) Fact remains you couldn’t buy an old maid on Domo for what he paid us up front for our services. If you work out the daily rate...
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 28
It will be worth it. If you could only read as well as you moan, you’d be able to study Rennol’s stolen papers.
He says he nicked them from Deela’s old man, but...
They are genuine. The computer date-checked.
Yeah, yeah, ‘priceless treasure’, something old, unique, blah blah. But why not say what it is?

Doesn’t want it public knowledge, I suppose. In times of war, civilian assets are often confiscated. (IRRITABLY) You’d rather I didn’t take the gamble? You want to be a mercenary grunt your whole life? Or do you want to make a real killing for a change?
You really think this could be the big one?
If it isn’t, I’1l let you get straight back to the killing you prefer. Rennol, Deela, the boy — they’1l be all yours.
FX: JUDDER IN SHIP’S ENGINES
Taking her down.
FX: CROSS TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 29
15. INT. HOSS’S SPACESHIP: HOLD
FX: LANDING NOISE ENDS THROUGH:
All right, Deela. We’re landing, they’1ll be coming for us. Once we’re in the Palace, we can try to get away to the hidden door, then into the catacombs...
Vizz, if we try to run they’1ll shoot us down. They only need our lips, remember?
I do remember. (BEAT) But if we could hide out in the palace catacombs, give them the slip, then double back and steal their spaceship...
Always the dreamer, Vizz.
You used to dream, too, Deela. What happened to make you stop?
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN
All right, you two. Rennol’s waiting. On your feet.
We’re off to your fancy palace.
It’s not mine. It was sequestered by Deela’s father when the war broke.
He secured it, Vizz. Protected it from looters. Better it at least stayed in the family than got wrecked.
Family? You two related then?
Not by blood.
We belong to the same clan.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 30

Belonged. Your father tried to have me removed permanently the first chance he got. I was lucky to get away with exile. If he protected this place, Deela, he had his own reasons — nothing to do with family.
Oi! Spare us. Her old man might be no expert in removal. But we are.
So don’t try anything — either of you. We’re going to meet Rennol in the Great Hall.
And since it’s your gaffe, ginger — you can lead the way.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 31
16. INT. BORROWED SPACESHIP
FX: FADE UP. DOCTOR IS BUSY AT CONTROLS. TENTATIVE BLEEPS
There! We’ll try that... (FX: CONSOLE EXPLODES IN SPARKS) Or... something else.
How much longer is this going to take?
The Doctor’s constructing a whole new operating system for the engines, Tegan.
After working on the TARDIS these last few days, it’s a little like giving up four-dimensional chess for a game of conkers.
FX: REASSURING HUM
Luckily, I’ve always been rather good at conkers.
It’s worked?
You sound surprised.
(FX: PRESSING SCANNER CONTROLS) Now the scanners are back online, I have a likely course vector for Turlough’s abductors. Reading zero-three-seven.
Tegan, can you programme that course? Use the keyboard to your left...
(FX: BLEEPS IN TIME) Zero... three... seven...
Press the blue button there and let’s.. (FX: ENGINES ACCELERATE WILDLY AS TEGAN HITS ENTER) Follow that spacecraft!!!
FX: SHIP ZOOMS AWAY. FADE
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 32
17. INT. PALACE: CORRIDOR/GREAT HALL

DOCTOR: We have to take that chance. I’11 make the modifications in orbit I think — first we’d better take off from this spaceport.
TEGAN: Why? It’ll be crawling with security types, officials, space police any moment. People trying to help.
DOCTOR: If we wait, we’ll lose the trail. And we can’t afford a delay. Turlough’s abductors are killers. He should be safe while they need him. But once their aims are achieved...
NYSSA: You’d better get to work.
NYSSA: (FX: WE HEAR THE DOCTOR PRESSING THE BUTTONS AND RESPONSIVE RUSH FROM ENGINES )
DOCTOR: Drive systems on line. (FX: BLEEP) There! And with any luck the automatic pilot will...
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 24
DOCTOR WHO: NYSSA/TEGAN:
DOCTOR: . take us up. Strap yourselves in, you two. This could get a little — bumpy!!!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 25
TURLOUGH: (COMING ROUND) Oh... my head.
DEELA: Vizz? Oh, thank Trion.
TURLOUGH: Deela?
DEELA: Here. Drink this. It should make you feel better.
TURLOUGH: I couldn’t feel much worse. (DRINKS) Where are we? What happened?
DEELA: Hoss and Kanch happened. We’re in the hold of their ship.
TURLOUGH: Who are they?
DEELA: They’re working for a man named Rennol. He kidnapped me weeks ago.
TURLOLUGH: Weeks?! ?
DEELA: I’ve been tranquilised for most of it. Then your DNA-trace was picked up on Vektris, and Hoss and Kanch took me there. They waited days trying to get a proper fix on you...
TURLOUGH: And when I came out of the TARDIS they got it. (SIGHS) What do these people want with me?
DEELA: That’s my Vizz.. Only caring about himself.
TURLOUGH: Should I care about you, after all that happened?
DEELA: It’s not my fault your family group chose the wrong side in the war.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 26
TURLOUGH: Proving my point. We never cared what was right or wrong in the old days, did we?
DEELA: Only what was right for us. (PAUSE) I never imagined the two of us would ever be alone together again. Did you?
TURLOUGH: (SOFTER) It’s a far cry from our Bubble, isn’t it?
DEELA: Oh, Vizz. Back then you were the only thing that made sense in my life. Now... you’re the only thing that can save it.
TURLOUGH: What are you talking about?
DEELA: Rennol knows about our Bubble. That’s why he needs us. Both of us.
TURLOUGH: But how could he know—?
DEELA: He stole things from my father — documents, papers.
TURLOUGH: (UNEASY) But why would this Rennol even care? (BEAT) I take it we’re on our way to the winter planet right now?
DEELA: Yes. Rennol’s waiting for us in the palace.
TURLOUGH: Home, sweet home.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 27
KANCH: Coming out of star-warp.. now.
HOSS: And there’s Planet Turlough.
KANCH: Call that a planet?
HOSS: There’s over a hundred rocks that size in this system, Kanch. Most of them owned by well-off Trions as stellar retreats, then abandoned at the start of the war. (BEAT) Rennol’s signal came from here?
KANCH: Yeah. And he’s got a life-sign damper in the atmosphere so it looks like a dead world — keep the Trion Repatriation Squads away. Plus the palace has its own covered landing bay, so the ships won’t show on any orbital scans.
HOSS: Very thorough. What about that tap I put on his personal comms? You’ve been monitoring?
KANCH: He’s only used it to talk to us. Course, he might have another comms. Private, like...
HOSS: He might. (BEAT) Well, take us down.
KANCH: It’s Rennol we should take down. This job’s dragged on for weeks.
HOSS: We’ve taken care of business in the downtime.
KANCH: Local debt collecting? (SNORTS) Fact remains you couldn’t buy an old maid on Domo for what he paid us up front for our services. If you work out the daily rate...
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 28
HOSS: It will be worth it. If you could only read as well as you moan, you’d be able to study Rennol’s stolen papers.
KANCH: He says he nicked them from Deela’s old man, but...
HOSS: They are genuine. The computer date-checked.
KANCH: Yeah, yeah, ‘priceless treasure’, something old, unique, blah blah. But why not say what it is?
HOSS: Doesn’t want it public knowledge, I suppose. In times of war, civilian assets are often confiscated. (IRRITABLY) You’d rather I didn’t take the gamble? You want to be a mercenary grunt your whole life? Or do you want to make a real killing for a change?
KANCH: You really think this could be the big one?
HOSS: If it isn’t, I’1l let you get straight back to the killing you prefer. Rennol, Deela, the boy — they’1l be all yours.
KANCH: Taking her down.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 29
TURLOUGH: All right, Deela. We’re landing, they’1ll be coming for us. Once we’re in the Palace, we can try to get away to the hidden door, then into the catacombs...
DEELA: Vizz, if we try to run they’1ll shoot us down. They only need our lips, remember?
TURLOUGH: I do remember. (BEAT) But if we could hide out in the palace catacombs, give them the slip, then double back and steal their spaceship...
DEELA: Always the dreamer, Vizz.
TURLOUGH: You used to dream, too, Deela. What happened to make you stop?
HOSS: All right, you two. Rennol’s waiting. On your feet.
KANCH: We’re off to your fancy palace.
TURLOUGH: It’s not mine. It was sequestered by Deela’s father when the war broke.
DEELA: He secured it, Vizz. Protected it from looters. Better it at least stayed in the family than got wrecked.
HOSS: Family? You two related then?
TURLOUGH: Not by blood.
DEELA: We belong to the same clan.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 30
TURLOUGH: Belonged. Your father tried to have me removed permanently the first chance he got. I was lucky to get away with exile. If he protected this place, Deela, he had his own reasons — nothing to do with family.
KANCH: Oi! Spare us. Her old man might be no expert in removal. But we are.
HOSS: So don’t try anything — either of you. We’re going to meet Rennol in the Great Hall.
KANCH: And since it’s your gaffe, ginger — you can lead the way.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 31
DOCTOR: There! We’ll try that... (FX: CONSOLE EXPLODES IN SPARKS) Or... something else.
TEGAN: How much longer is this going to take?
NYSSA: The Doctor’s constructing a whole new operating system for the engines, Tegan.
DOCTOR: After working on the TARDIS these last few days, it’s a little like giving up four-dimensional chess for a game of conkers.
DOCTOR: Luckily, I’ve always been rather good at conkers.
TEGAN: It’s worked?
DOCTOR: You sound surprised.
NYSSA: (FX: PRESSING SCANNER CONTROLS) Now the scanners are back online, I have a likely course vector for Turlough’s abductors. Reading zero-three-seven.
DOCTOR: Tegan, can you programme that course? Use the keyboard to your left...
TEGAN: (FX: BLEEPS IN TIME) Zero... three... seven...
DOCTOR: Press the blue button there and let’s.. (FX: ENGINES ACCELERATE WILDLY AS TEGAN HITS ENTER) Follow that spacecraft!!!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 32
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: FADE UP. KANCH & HOSS HERDING TURLOUGH & DEELA ALONG. THE PALACE IS OLD, COLD AND ECHOING. TEETH-CHATTERING, SHIVERS ETC)
KANCH: (WALKING) Oh, very posh. Always fancied a place like this. Sculptures. Nice drawings on the walls...
HOSS: (WALKING) They’re called paintings, Kanch.
KANCH: (WALKING) All of that, yeah. (STOPS) This palace is an auction waiting to happen, Hoss. We’1ll need another ship to fit everything in. What about it, Ginger — you’1l help us load up, right?
DEELA: Don’t rise to the bait, Vizz.
TURLOUGH: I thought you wanted to reach the Great Hall?
HOSS: Good point. Keep moving.
DEELA: (WALKING) I didn’t think I’d ever see this place again, Vizz.
TURLOUGH: (WALKING) I’ve been trying to get home, fooling myself I could be happy if I could only make it back. That I could belong. But...
KANCH: (TO STOP) But no-one cares.
HOSS: Is the Great Hall through here?
TURLOUGH: Yes. The doors are Majorican oak, you may find them a little stiff.
KANCH: I doubt it. (EFFORT AS —)
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 33
TURLOUGH: Yes, one usually tries the handle before one resorts to using one’s boots?
HOSS: Shut it, Ginger. (CALLING WHILE STEPPING INTO GREAT HALL) Rennol? Rennol — we’ve brought Deela and the boy as agreed.
RENNOL: (OFF) I can see. (FX: SCRAPE OF A CHAIR AS HE RISES AND MEASURED FOOTSTEPS AS HE WALKS) Finally. The key has been delivered. Now we can begin.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 34
TEGAN: Any change in course, Nyssa?
NYSSA: Not yet... wait. There’s a disturbance in the background radiation. A big plasma spill.
DOCTOR: Caused by some kind of manoeuvre, perhaps? Thank you, Nyssa. Time to put on the brakes!
TEGAN: Oh, thank heavens. Is that an asteroid up ahead?
DOCTOR: I think it’s a planet.
NYSSA: The planet where Turlough’s been taken?
DOCTOR: So it seems. The trail leads here. (BEAT) I’1ll take us ina little lower.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 35
HOSS: Deela, Turlough — get inside.
KANCH: (PUSHES THEM) Do as Hoss says.
RENNOL: Yes, do. You don’t want to argue with a gun like that in a hand like hers.
TURLOUGH: I take it you’re Rennol?
RENNOL: Halquin Rennol, businessman and entrepreneur.
TURLOUGH: And squatter.
RENNOL: Not though choice, I assure you. Tracking you down has taken longer than anticipated. I’ve had to live in this primitive hovel for weeks.
KANCH: Yeah, we take all the risks abducting the boy, while you take it easy.
RENNOL: I got you the girl, didn’t I? And what do you mean, easy? Dismantling the defences around the palace was anything but. Force shields, stasis traps...
HOSS: Deela’s father’s documents showed you where the defences were set.
RENNOL: I’m not an expert. That’s why I hired you.
TURLOUGH: You should’ve hired a cleaner while you were at it. The upholstery on the chairs has a pattern under all that dust, you know.
RENNOL: You won’t be sitting down, Turlough. Just kiss Deela.
DEELA: What?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 36
TURLOUGH: I.. I don’t understand.
RENNOL: (IMPATIENT) Kiss her, Turlough. I know that’s the only way to open your “bubble”.
KANCH: And if her face isn’t an incentive, how about my gun in yours?
TURLOUGH: This is ridiculous! You can’t just expect us to — [kiss]
DEELA: (AWKWARD) Oh, come on, Vizz. Not so bad, is it? Sooner we do as they say, the sooner they’1ll let us go.
TURLOUGH: But will they?
DEELA: Old times. Come on, we each put one hand on the wall, turn in, and...
KANCH: Well?
HOSS: Nothing.
RENNOL: Where is it? The dimensional vault? It’s supposed to open.
TURLOUGH: I don’t know. The entrance used to appear beside the fireplace.
DEELA: Maybe... our lips didn’t touch for long enough?
KANCH: Or maybe this is a trick.
TURLOUGH: How could it be? You brought me here yourself!
RENNOL: The power can’t be getting through to the portal circuit...
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 37
TURLOUGH: What’s that?
HOSS: My wrist communicator’s linked to the ship’s computer. (FX: HITS BUTTONS ON COMMS) Something’s entered the planet’s approach zone.
KANCH: We can’t have been followed. We were in star-warp.
HOSS: There’s a ship in low orbit. Most likely scanning the surface.
DEELA: A Trion ship?
HOSS: Maybe Rennol taking down the security systems alerted somebody.
TURLOUGH: (MUTTERS) Or else it’s the Doctor...
RENNOL: Relax. To any probing scanners, nobody’s home, remember?
HOSS: We’re taking no chances. Kanch, get back to the ship and check it out. If it’s law enforcement, sit tight. Anyone else...
KANCH: BOOM! Ha. I’m all over it. Me and a ground-to-air proton cannon are like these two lovebirds — made for each other. (EXITS, WHISTLING JAUNTILY )
DEELA: (QUIET) I hope your friends didn’t follow you, Vizz.
TURLOUGH: (QUIET) So do I.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 38
TEGAN: It’s all so white down there. Frozen. No sign of life.
DOCTOR: I disagree. Look — signs of cultivation in the snowfields ahead. An estate, perhaps?
TEGAN: And the lord of the manor must live right there. Look!
NYSSA: A palace!
DOCTOR: Magnificent, isn’t it? Could use a little restoration, but...
DOCTOR: (FX: PROTON CANNON BLAST HITS OUTSIDE OF SHIP. EXPLOSION. ALARM SENSORS SHRILL INSIDE COCKPIT)
TEGAN: Whoa! What the...?
TEGAN: NYSSA3: That shot... came out of nowhere!
DOCTOR: I’m a fool! I should’ve guessed they’d be prepared for anyone following.
NYSSA: Turlough’s abductors are in the palace?
DOCTOR: Must be.
TEGAN: Get us out of here!
TEGAN: (FX: POWER DISCHARGING IN ALARMINGLY NOISY FASHION. ATMOSPHERE WHINE RISING)
DOCTOR: I can’t. The blast has crippled the drive systems. Nyssa, your readings...?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 39
NYSSA: Life support unstable.
TEGAN: What?
NYSSA: Scans and navigation off-line! We’re flying blind.
DOCTOR: We’re not flying at all. We’re falling. Strap yourselves in, quickly. And brace yourselves. —
TEGAN: We’re going to crash!
TEGAN: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 40

elements.text: PART TWO
Scans and navigation off-line! We’re flying blind.
We’re not flying at all. We’re falling. Strap yourselves in, quickly. And brace yourselves. —
FX: SCREAMING ENGINES REACH HIGHEST PITCH
We’re going to crash!
CUT TO:
21. INT. GREAT HALL
FX: ROAR OF BORROWED SHIP COMING DOWN OVERHEAD
Kanch didn’t miss. Here comes that ship!
Yes, straight for us!
What?!
We need to take cover. The dining table, it’s solid...
Or one of the archways.
Stay where you are. It’s not going to hit us.
(RISING PANIC) It is! It is!!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 41
22. INT. BORROWED SPACESHIP
FX: SHIP GOING DOWN FAST
(FX: STRAPPING SELF IN) What are our chances of making it through this in one piece?
Brave heart, Tegan.
(GROANS) They’re bad.
Doctor, is there any crash protection?
Nothing as standard... Wait! The gravity wells. If we can cushion our fall by jettisoning sufficient gravitational mass.
NYSSA3: We can’t!
The gravity wells are patched into the engine boosters, remember? (FX: HITS BUTTONS) I can reconfigure the outlet again, route it through to the ship’s exterior.
I mean, we can’t risk it — the change in pressure could buckle the hull or split open the planet!
We'll do that anyway when we hit.
Tegan’s right. We have to take that chance. If I can make the adjustments and convince the computer to go along with it in time...
Here comes the ground!
FX: SHIP HITS GROUND WITH A WHOMPF! CUT HARD TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 42
23. INT. GREAT HALL
FX: SMASHING GLASS. DEBRIS FALLING
BEAT
(COUGHS) Hoss? Are you...?
(COUGHS) I’ve lived through worse than a window breaking over me, Rennol.
(SUPRESSED SPLUTTER) Where did the ship come down?
The other side of the palace. They must’ve taken half the hillside with them.
We could all have been killed!
Question is, has Kanch killed everyone on board? It looked like a mining ship. We parked beside one on Vektris. Kanch shot the owner.
And his crew came after you for revenge?
Or Turlough’s friend the Doctor came, hoping to pull off a rescue.
Some hope. —
(FX: SIMULTANEOUSLY, A SMALL TREMOR THROUGH THE PALACE. JUDDERING OF FURNITURE. MORE DEBRIS)
Can you feel that?
What?
Like... I don’t know, a little like shockwaves.
You saw how hard that ship hit.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 43
I’ve been feeling them for days, on and off.
Yes, it’s a different sort of tremor. Like... it’s coming from inside the palace.
FX: ANOTHER SMALL TREMOR
There is something.
Just aftershocks. How old is this place — hundreds of years?
(DISTRACTED) Almost a thousand.
Probably ready to come crashing down around our ears.
So let’s get what we came for. Deela — kiss Turlough again.
But you saw what happened.
Or didn’t happen.
Do it. That jolt to the foundations might have shaken awake the power systems.
Oh, very scientific.
More than you realise. (BEAT — THEN ANGRY) I want that “bubble” opened!
Look, there’s nothing in there of any value. If there was, I'd have stolen it myself, long ago!
Clearly, there’s something in there you missed.
(BRISK) Vizz, come on, let’s just do it. Hand on the wall, and... (SHE KISSES HIM)
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 44
BEAT
Nothing. Try again.
(KISSES TURLOUGH AGAIN. BEAT) Why isn’t it working?
I don’t know.
But you must’ve built this vault?
No. I... adapted it. Augmented the entry coder.
Augmented it how? (PAUSE) Tell us!
Originally it was primed to accept the DNA of my great- grandfather. As one of his descendants, my DNA was a good enough match. So I reprogrammed it to accept only a random mingling of my DNA and...
. Deela’s.
(SNEERS) How very adolescent.
That’s exactly what we were.
A second kiss sealed the Bubble off again.
Very sweet. But I want to know exactly how this handy dimensional vault you “augmented” came to be here. So come boy — start talking.
on,
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 45
24. INT. BORROWED SPACESHIP
(FX: AFTERMATH OF CRASH. SMASHED CONTROLS SPARK AND FIZZ SPASMODICALLY )
(FX: RELEASING SEATBELT) Ohhh...
You all right, Nyssa?
I think so. You?
Nothing seems to be broken... (FX: RELEASES SEATBELT) Doctor?
Yes. Yes, I’m all right. (FX: RELEASES SEATBELT)
All right? Credit where credit’s due, you’re amazing — you did
it!
FX: SUPPORT STRUT COLLAPSES CLOSE BY WITH RENDING OF METAL
Agh! But you’ll spoil it a bit if you kill us.
(GETTING UP) Hull integrity’s been compromised in the crash. The ship’s collapsing.
(GETTING UP) Least that’s given us a short cut out to the
surface.
Then let’s take it. Quickly.
I agree.
FX: DOOR GRINDS OPEN. THEY STAGGER OUT OF SHIP INTO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 46
25. EXT. FROZEN PLANET SURFACE
FX: OUTDOORS AMBIENCE. EERIE WIND
It’s freezing out here!
We’re not exactly dressed for it.
Careful. The gravity’s lighter than we’re used to. Of course that could be lingering traces from the emptied wells. (FX: JUMPS ONTO SNOWY GROUND, FOLLOWED BY TEGAN)
(STEADYING SELF) Are the wells those big tube things?
Yes, though the gravity generators inside are relatively small... Here, Nyssa, let me help you down from there.
There’s no need.
The ground’s icy. Doesn’t feel too steady. But that might just be my legs.
(CLIMBING DOWN FROM SHIP) It does feel unsteady...
FX: NOISE OF TREMORS — COMES AND GOES THROUGHOUT
Doctor! The ground’s splitting.
(SHOUTS) The gravity buttresses must’ve weakened the whole area — it’s giving way. Run, Tegan. Get back from the ship.
(BACKING OFF) What about you?
We'll be joining you. Come on, Nyssa.
Doctor, the ice, it’s cracking open...
FX: GROUND COLLAPSES
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 47
(FALLING) I’m falling...!
Nyssa! (SHE STARTS FORWARD)
Tegan, stay back.
How far has she dropped? Maybe there’s a ledge. Maybe...
She’s still falling. (BEAT) Thankfully, she’s falling slowly.
What?
More of that displaced gravity from the wells.
(CALLING FROM BELOW) I’m all right.
We must get down there, get her out.
I’ll go. Wait for us here, we may need your help climbing up again.
I want to come!
Too risky. The local gravity field will be in flux down there. It’s reducing our weight right now, but it could shift and crush us at any second.
(SULKY) Fine. Get going. Good luck.
Thank you. (CALLING DOWN) Nyssa! Are you all right? Can you hear me?
(FROM BELOW) Yes. I can see solid ground. There are tunnels down here. Partly caved in, but... passable I think.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 48
Wait for me there. (TO TEGAN) See you shortly, Tegan. (TO SELF) Now, one small step for a Time Lord... but one giant LEAP... (JUMPS INTO THE CHASM)
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 49
26. INT. GREAT HALL
Come on, boy. We’re waiting. Tell us about your ‘bubble’.
The dimensional vault was a secret part of the palace architecture. Hoss. I’ve no idea how old it is.
(KNOWINGLY) Haven’t you?
My father certainly didn’t know anything about it. I only stumbled upon it myself when Deela was researching our clan’s history and discovered some of my great-grandfather’s old journals.
He was a real black sheep. Where you get it from, Vizz.
Great-grandfather helped set up a smuggling operation. He was storing contraband for space pirates in the ultimate safe house...
A pocket dimension?
Don’t ask me how a Trion had access to that kind of technology back then. He shouldn’t have done. Either he was a visionary inventor —
Or he stole alien tech.
That’s the likeliest explanation.
His own great-grandfather was an ambassador to alien worlds in Trion’s colonial era, a member of the Royal Court. Building our colonies had upset a lot of other space powers...
By the time the Arar-Jecks had fought their way to Trion’s borders, this ambassador had done defence deals with many species — so there are clear links.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 50
Anyway, I didn’t care about any of that at the time. All I knew was that Deela and I were the only two people alive who knew about my great-grandfather’s secret.
The old boy tried to double-cross the smugglers, and they killed him for it.
But if you didn’t understand the technology, how did you adapt the entry coder?
You don’t have to understand the insides of a computer to make it work, do you? I’m not saying it was easy to get the vault open, but...
DEELAs: We translated the interface codes...
And I found the hidden portal controls. Two hundred years old, at least.
The technology behind them is far older...
Who knows? Or cares.
The portal appeared there, beside the fireplace. It opened onto a circular space as large as this room. Sort of.. pale and translucent. Shimmering like crystal. We felt so safe inside.
I’m sure you miss it terribly.
It was a good place to go to escape the boring world, a place our elders and betters didn’t know existed. That’s all. No magic, no great secrets.
Does his story tally with your own intelligence, Rennol?
Oh... Near enough. (HE STEPS CLOSER TO TURLOUGH) Where are the hidden controls for the portal, Turlough?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 51
It’s... a virtual interface. If the power supply is damaged we can’t access them.
FX: LASER BLAST. NEARBY TAPESTRY BURSTS INTO FLAME
That was a warning shot. A tapestry instead of your head. Lie to us again...
One of the stones pulls out from the wall.
(ANGRY) Deela!
This one. The workings are built in behind. That’s why we had to touch the wall, it connects to our own bodies to measure the genetic transfer.
Hoss, help me move the stone.
FX: EFFORT — PULLING HEAVY STONE FROM WALL
(DONE) Well, the circuitry doesn’t look too exotic.
The lash-up you see to the fore is my handiwork.
Then you’re well-placed to repair it.

Kanch has a toolset on board the ship. I’11 call him and get him to bring them. And then you’d better get the vault open before the sun is up, boy. If you can’t, your next kiss comes from the end of my gun.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 52
27. INT. CAVED-IN CATACOMBS

(FX: EERIE ATMOSPHERE DOWN HERE. WIND BLOWING AND FAINT RUMBLING VOICE. THESE WORDS SHOULDN’T BE EASILY DECIPHERABLE HERE — THEY ARE THE FIRST INDICATION OF THE MORASS FORMING, PERHAPS CHANGING SPEED AS THEY GO)
Enemy strike... STRIKE LANDED. Going to war footing. Prepare for absorption.
FX: WHISPERS REPEATED QUIETLY UNDER REST OF SCENE
Hello? Is anyone there?
(CALLING FROM ABOVE) Nyssa!
(LOOKING UP) Doctor, I’m here!
(COMING DOWN) Are you hurt?
(LOOKING UP) No, I landed lightly... Watch out, there are stalagmites stretching up nearer the ground. I caught hold of one and used it to break my fall.
Where...? Ah, yes. (EFFORT AS HE DOES THE SAME) And then, drift to the ground... (LANDS) .. as gently as a leaf in autumn.
If only autumn leaves could drift back up again.
While we still weigh so little, perhaps we can jump and... (JUMPS — LANDS AGAIN, NORMALLY) Ah.
We’re normal weight again. If that had happened a few moments sooner while you were on your way down...
That’s why I asked Tegan to wait for us.
I’m not sure it’s any safer up there. If whoever shot us down comes looking... poor Tegan’s alone.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 53
I didn’t want to leave her. (FX: SLIGHT TREMOR, AS IN PREVIOUS PALACE SCENE) The question is, are WE alone?
That scraping sound. It seems to be coming from the rock.
Tectonic activity? Hmm. There’s definitely a vibration of some kind. Can you feel it?
NYSSAs: Yes. But is it natural or artificial?
Good question. It could be coming from some sort of power source. Perhaps these catacombs are in use? Given their proximity to the palace...
One of these tunnels might lead there.
Or even back to the surface. You must have seen the walls of this chasm — they’re sheer. There’s no way we can climb out.
I agree.
Time for an expedition, then. Splendid. (CALLING UP) Tegan! I’ve found Nyssa. She’s all right. We’re going to look into these catacombs and try to find a way back up to you. [..]

DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 50
TURLOUGH: Anyway, I didn’t care about any of that at the time. All I knew was that Deela and I were the only two people alive who knew about my great-grandfather’s secret.
DEELA: The old boy tried to double-cross the smugglers, and they killed him for it.
HOSS: But if you didn’t understand the technology, how did you adapt the entry coder?
TURLOUGH: You don’t have to understand the insides of a computer to make it work, do you? I’m not saying it was easy to get the vault open, but...
TURLOUGH: DEELAs: We translated the interface codes...
TURLOUGH: And I found the hidden portal controls. Two hundred years old, at least.
RENNOL: The technology behind them is far older...
TURLOUGH: Who knows? Or cares.
DEELA: The portal appeared there, beside the fireplace. It opened onto a circular space as large as this room. Sort of.. pale and translucent. Shimmering like crystal. We felt so safe inside.
RENNOL: I’m sure you miss it terribly.
TURLOUGH: It was a good place to go to escape the boring world, a place our elders and betters didn’t know existed. That’s all. No magic, no great secrets.
HOSS: Does his story tally with your own intelligence, Rennol?
RENNOL: Oh... Near enough. (HE STEPS CLOSER TO TURLOUGH) Where are the hidden controls for the portal, Turlough?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 51
TURLOUGH: It’s... a virtual interface. If the power supply is damaged we can’t access them.
HOSS: That was a warning shot. A tapestry instead of your head. Lie to us again...
DEELA: One of the stones pulls out from the wall.
TURLOUGH: (ANGRY) Deela!
DEELA: This one. The workings are built in behind. That’s why we had to touch the wall, it connects to our own bodies to measure the genetic transfer.
RENNOL: Hoss, help me move the stone.
HOSS: (DONE) Well, the circuitry doesn’t look too exotic.
TURLOUGH: The lash-up you see to the fore is my handiwork.
RENNOL: Then you’re well-placed to repair it.
HOSS: Kanch has a toolset on board the ship. I’11 call him and get him to bring them. And then you’d better get the vault open before the sun is up, boy. If you can’t, your next kiss comes from the end of my gun.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 52
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: EERIE ATMOSPHERE DOWN HERE. WIND BLOWING AND FAINT RUMBLING VOICE. THESE WORDS SHOULDN’T BE EASILY DECIPHERABLE HERE — THEY ARE THE FIRST INDICATION OF THE MORASS FORMING, PERHAPS CHANGING SPEED AS THEY GO)
MORASS: Enemy strike... STRIKE LANDED. Going to war footing. Prepare for absorption.
NYSSA: Hello? Is anyone there?
DOCTOR: (CALLING FROM ABOVE) Nyssa!
NYSSA: (LOOKING UP) Doctor, I’m here!
DOCTOR: (COMING DOWN) Are you hurt?
NYSSA: (LOOKING UP) No, I landed lightly... Watch out, there are stalagmites stretching up nearer the ground. I caught hold of one and used it to break my fall.
DOCTOR: Where...? Ah, yes. (EFFORT AS HE DOES THE SAME) And then, drift to the ground... (LANDS) .. as gently as a leaf in autumn.
NYSSA: If only autumn leaves could drift back up again.
DOCTOR: While we still weigh so little, perhaps we can jump and... (JUMPS — LANDS AGAIN, NORMALLY) Ah.
NYSSA: We’re normal weight again. If that had happened a few moments sooner while you were on your way down...
DOCTOR: That’s why I asked Tegan to wait for us.
NYSSA: I’m not sure it’s any safer up there. If whoever shot us down comes looking... poor Tegan’s alone.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 53
DOCTOR: I didn’t want to leave her. (FX: SLIGHT TREMOR, AS IN PREVIOUS PALACE SCENE) The question is, are WE alone?
NYSSA: That scraping sound. It seems to be coming from the rock.
DOCTOR: Tectonic activity? Hmm. There’s definitely a vibration of some kind. Can you feel it?
DOCTOR: NYSSAs: Yes. But is it natural or artificial?
DOCTOR: Good question. It could be coming from some sort of power source. Perhaps these catacombs are in use? Given their proximity to the palace...
NYSSA: One of these tunnels might lead there.
DOCTOR: Or even back to the surface. You must have seen the walls of this chasm — they’re sheer. There’s no way we can climb out.
NYSSA: I agree.
DOCTOR: Time for an expedition, then. Splendid. (CALLING UP) Tegan! I’ve found Nyssa. She’s all right. We’re going to look into these catacombs and try to find a way back up to you. [..]
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 54
DOCTOR: (FX: DISTANT, FROM BELOW) [..] Stay close to the ship. We’1l be as quick as we can.
TEGAN: (SHOUTS BACK) All right! Be careful! (TO SELF) Stay close? I’1l stay inside — I’m frozen solid out here. Please let whoever owned this wreck have left some warm clothes on board.
TEGAN: (FX: SHE STEPS TENTATIVELY INSIDE THE CRASHED SHIP — LOUD PROTESTING CREAK OF METAL)
TEGAN: And please don’t let anything fall on top of me before I find them!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 55
KANCH: (CALLING FROM CORRIDOR, OFF) Hoss? Hoss! Which way is it again? These tools weigh a ton!
HOSS: In here, Kanch!
RENNOL: Finally.
DEELA: (QUIET) Thought he’d found the hidden way into the catacombs for a minute, Vizz.
TURLOUGH: (QUIET) If we can only get there...
DEELA: (QUIET) We don’t need to. If we do as they say they’1l let us
DEELA: go.
TURLOUGH: (QUIET) Look at them! The queen of space trash, a frustrated fop who looks ready for a nervous breakdown and...
TURLOUGH: (QUIET) .. that maniac!
RENNOL: You nearly brought that ship down on our heads, Kanch. Almost got us killed.
KANCH: No ‘almost’ with me, Rennol. If I wanted you killed — you would be. (BEAT) Vault not open yet?
HOSS: Obviously not.
RENNOL: But we have uncovered the portal generation interface.
HOSS: The controls that the kissing key unlocks.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 56
TURLOUGH: For all the good it does. You can see the circuitry is largely crystalline. It was decaying when I altered it last time, and now...
RENNOL: The circuitry ought to regenerate itself. In his notes, Deela’s father is most emphatic about that.
TURLOUGH: He’s always emphatic — never more so than when he’s wrong.
HOSS: Well if it won’t repair itself you’1ll have to do it. (PAUSE) Now.
KANCH: Or the girl gets hurt. (GRABS DEELA)
DEELA: (GASPS, GRABBED BY KANCH) Please, Vizz!
TURLOUGH: I can’t!
DEELA: At least try!
TURLOUGH: You can’t hurt her, Kanch. Not if you want to get into the vault.
KANCH: I'll leave her face alone. But the rest...
HOSS: Oh, leave her be, Kanch. Gallantry doesn’t come easily to this one. It’s his own skin he cares about. (GRABS TURLOUGH BY THROAT) Ian’t that right, Ginger?
TURLOUGH: (CHOKING) Please, let go...
HOSS: And if he wants his skin to keep fitting he’1ll get on with repairing the circuit NOW. (RELEASES HIM)
TURLOUGH: (PANTING) All right. All right!
DEELA: (AGGRIEVED) Oh, so now you’ll help?!?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 57
TURLOUGH: I.. I'll start by testing the holo-cell circuits with your charge-driver...
HOSS: To be on the safe side, Kanch, I think we’d better check out the wreck of that ship you brought down.
KANCH: Loot it, you mean?
HOSS: No, to be sure everyone aboard is dead and that no one’s heading this way with a grudge and a big gun. (BEAT) Remember, any survivors will be friends of Ginger’s. To us, expendable. But to him...
RENNOL: Yes. We might yet find a way to increase Turlough’s enthusiasm for the job in hand...
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 58
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: THE DOCTOR AND NYSSA ARE FEELING THEIR WAY THROUGH THE ICY TUNNELS. THE GRATING WHISPERS ARE HERE, SLOWLY GROWING LOUDER AND LEGIBLE)
MORASS: War footing. Impact absorbed. Invaders. Morass. Absorbing.
NYSSA: (WALKING) Doctor...
DOCTOR: (WALKING) Yes, Nyssa?
NYSSA: (WALKING) None of these passages are leading upward to the surface...
DOCTOR: (STOPPING) No. Not yet, anyway.
NYSSA: (STOPPED) And that sound seems louder. I’m not convinced it’s down to the gravity field permeating the rock.
DOCTOR: Neither am I.
NYSSA: It’s too regular. Like a message. A repeated message.
DOCTOR: A repeated message? Interesting. There’s something else: it seems to be getting lighter.
NYSSA: You’re right.
DOCTOR: The ice in these catacombs would appear to have some rather peculiar properties.
NYSSA: Luminescence?
DOCTOR: That’s one. Now, feel the wall here. Feel the ice.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 59
NYSSA: 3: Cold. Wet.
DOCTOR: And?
NYSSA: A.. sort of tingling.
DOCTOR: Yes. Possibly a kind of molecular oscillation, producing the charge of light — a part of the design of these catacombs. Judging from the striations in the rock at regular intervals I’d hazard a guess the passages didn’t form naturally. They were mined out by machines.
NYSSA: I see what you mean.
DOCTOR: It’s just a pity whoever built them didn’t put up a few road Signs while they were about it.
DOCTOR: (FX: AT THIS POINT MORASS WORDS GET LOUD ENOUGH TO BE HEARD — THOUGH STILL VERY DISTORTED)
NYSSA: Do you think this repeated message is anything to do with the molecular oscillation, Doctor? Doctor?
DOCTOR: Ssh, I’m trying to listen.
MORASS: . Absorbing. Morass. Absorbing.
NYSSA: Sounds like it’s saying... ‘absorbing morass’. A morass of what?
DOCTOR: I don’t know. But what if that noise is being made by some kind of life form, using the ice as a medium to speak through?
NYSSA: Well, why would you think that?
DOCTOR: Because I’m looking at that life form now.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 60
TEGAN: (PUTTING A COAT ON) Guess a coat’s a coat, whatever it smells like. Ugh.
TEGAN: (SOTTO) And a scary noise is just a scary noise until...
KANCH: (OFF) Gaw! Made a mess of this old tug, didn’t I, Hoss?
TEGAN: (SOTTO) .. until you know you’ve got company.
HOSS: (OFF) We search it. From top to bottom.
KANCH: (OFF) Come on. No one could’ve survived a crash like this! It’s caved in half the hillside.
HOSS: (OFF) We’ll know for sure when we’ve found the bodies.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 61
RENNOL: Any progress, Turlough?
TURLOUGH: Not yet.
DEELA: Why isn’t the system responding?
RENNOL: You hear that? Deela wants this all over. She wants to go home.
TURLOUGH: I don’t have a home to go to and you’ve most likely murdered my friends. Where do I go, Rennol?
RENNOL: That’1ll be down to you.
TURLOUGH: (SIGHS) I don’t know what’s wrong. It’s possible my adaptation has led to some kind of power seepage.
DEELA: But it’s only been a few years since we used it last.
TURLOUGH: (INSTANT) Three-and-three-quarter years. (EMBARRASSED) Give or take.
RENNOL: I wonder if you’re telling me the truth about these systems.
TURLOUGH: Do you?
RENNOL: Look at these. (FX. BIP! WHIRRRR) Schematics stolen from Deela’s father. Wiring diagrams, right?
TURLOUGH: Not a design I recognise.
RENNOL: There’s a power source marked here — right? But it bears zero resemblance to that circuit. So how do you explain it?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 62
TURLOUGH: (ANGRY) I don’t know where your wiring diagram comes from! This is the only circuit I’m aware of, here in the wall. There could well be other systems behind it, and that could be where the power to the portal generator has seeped into — but this is the interface I used to gain access to the Bubble.
TURLOUGH: (FX: DISTANT CRASH — HEAVY LIKE ROCK SMASHING TO THE GROUND, MUFFLED )
DEELA: What was that?
RENNOL: (UNNERVED) Just... Hoss and Kanch. Must be them coming back.
TURLOUGH: That vibration in the floor. I can still feel it...
RENNOL: Shut up. And remember I have my own gun. Keep working on that circuit. (CROSSES TO DOOR. CALLS) Hoss? Kanch, is that you?
DEELA: (SOTTO) Vizz, were you really going to let Kanch hurt me?
TURLOUGH: (SOTTO) I’m sorry if it seemed that way. I... I just wanted them to see they couldn’t push me and you around.
DEELA: (SOTTO) You never were a good liar.
TURLOUGH: (SOTTO) Listen. If there IS some great treasure in the vault, why should they have it?
DEELA: (SOTTO) You mean you CAN open the Bubble?
TURLOUGH: (SOTTO) Whatever’s in there, whatever we missed before — I think we deserve first crack at it, don’t you?
DEELA: (SOTTO) We? You and me? Like in the old days?
RENNOL: (WALKING UP) What’re you two whispering about?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 63
DEELA: I’m just trying to help him. (THEN LOWER, TO TURLOUGH) When you do get it working... d’you think the portal will open on the first kiss?
TURLOUGH: It’s been some time. It may take several goes.
DEELA: (SOFTLY) Good.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 64
KANCH: Reckon that’s the whole ship, Hoss-boss, and we haven’t trodden on anything nasty.
HOSS: Maybe not. But someone’s been treading ice in here.
KANCH: What?
HOSS: Footprints, see? Still wet.
KANCH: Well — they must be ours.
HOSS: Except that neither of us is wearing heels.
KANCH: Survivors? Where’re they hiding?
HOSS: We’1ll soon see. (CALLS) In ten seconds we’re going to destroy this spaceship. Ten. Nine. Eight. Kanch, prime the frag grenade. Seven. Six. Five.
TEGAN: (OFF, METAL ECHO) (TO SELF) Oh, rabbits! (ALOUD, STEPPING OUT FROM OFF) All right! All right, I’m coming out. —
KANCH: Ohh, she was in the gravity well! Clever.
HOSS: You. Come forward. What’s your name?
TEGAN: Tegan Jovanka.
HOSS: Where are your associates, Tegan?
TEGAN: Dead.
HOSS: Is that so.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 65
TEGAN: The Doctor was killed on Vektris when you took off. My friend Nyssa got out, but slipped and fell down that crevasse.
HOSS: How unfortunate. All of you dying for one solitary, snot-nosed boy.
TEGAN: What have you done with Turlough?
HOSS: Put him to work. Something of a first, I’d imagine. Oh, and just in case you only imagined the fate of your friend — Kanch, frag the ship, just to be on the safe side.
KANCH: Fragging it. Thirty second fuse.
TEGAN: Do what you want. Just take me to Turlough.
KANCH: This way. (BEAT) I’d shift if I were you. When that thing goes up there’s going to be a mighty big bang.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 66
MORASS: Data assimilating. Power charging.
NYSSA: (HORROR) Look at it. Is it... a man?
DOCTOR: Humanoid certainly. In this light, through the ice, it’s hard to be any more accurate.
NYSSA: His mouth is moving... Can he be alive in there? Cryogenics might be able to preserve the body...
DOCTOR: While he’s still conscious? I don’t know. As I said, this ice has some very interesting properties.
DOCTOR: (FX: ENORMOUS BLAST FROM ABOVE RATTLES THE CATACOMBS — THE CRASHED SPACESHIP GOING UP. DEBRIS FALLS FROM ROOF)
DOCTOR: NYSSA3: What was that?
MORASS: (CLEARER NOW — AND EVEN SCARIER) War footing. War footing.
DOCTOR: It came from above ground. Whatever it was, he seems to have found it disagreeable.
MORASS: Absorbing. Morass, I shall be. Morass, we shall be. Morass, they shall be.
DOCTOR: Or perhaps the reverse. Drawing energy from the percussive impact moving through the rock.
NYSSA: Doctor! The light!
DOCTOR: Yes. Cover your eyes, Nyssa!
NYSSA: It’s everywhere!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 67
DOCTOR: The ice crystals seem to be transmitting [energy. ]
DOCTOR: (FX: DROWNED OUT AS PART OF THE ICE WALL EXPLODES. SKITTERING SHARDS OF ICE)
NYSSA: Doctor! The ice, it’s cracking open!
DOCTOR: Yes. I’d stand back if I were you.
DOCTOR: (FX: EXPLOSION AS ICE WALL BURSTS AGAIN. MORE ICE EXPLOSIONS MORE QUIETLY, ELSEWHERE IN THE STEREO FIELD. )
NYSSA: Are we under attack?
DOCTOR: It would seem so.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 68
TURLOUGH: (TO SELF) (FX: TURNING MECHANISM) Come on, turn. Turn!
DEELA: What is it?
RENNOL: What have you found?
TURLOUGH: That power seepage. Something’s getting through — a little of this decay has self-repaired —
RENNOL: . but?
TURLOUGH: . but, the bulk of the energy’s being diverted. That schematic of yours really must relate to some other power source Deela’s father found here.
DEELA: In the wall, you mean?
TURLOUGH: Or beneath the floor... into the catacombs.
RENNOL: A back-up power generator?
DEELA: Could be the cause of the vibration. And it feels to be getting stronger.
TURLOUGH: It doesn’t really matter. The point is, if I can trap a little of the regenerating energy and loop it round the circuit, build the power that way...
RENNOL: And can you?
TURLOUGH: I need access to this lattice at the back, but this metal load- plate is blocking it. (STRAINS) It won’t budge. Rennol, you want whatever’s inside so much — why don’t you try to shift it?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 69
RENNOL: Of course. Tell you what, I’1l1 just put away the gun, turn my back to you and let you overpower me. (HARD) We’1l wait for Hoss and Kanch.
DEELA: You said that crashing noise was them coming ages ago. So where are they?
RENNOL: They’1ll be here.
TEGAN: (FROM CORRIDOR, STRUGGLING) Get your hands off of me!
HOSS: (FROM CORRIDOR, APPROACHING) Stop wriggling and we might.
RENNOL: (RELIEVED) See?
TEGAN: (SHOVED IN) I am not — wriggling!
KANCH: (ARRIVING) Hey — look what we found, hiding in the wreckage.
TURLOUGH: Tegan! You’re all right!
TEGAN: Oh, Turlough. Am I glad to see you.
TURLOUGH: You are?
RENNOL: Hoss, was it you who made that crashing noise?
HOSS: We blew up the wreck of their ship.
RENNOL: This sounded like it was inside. Something heavy falling.
HOSS: Knocked over by the impact, perhaps. Kanch, you’d better search the palace properly. Maybe Tegan’s friends aren’t as dead as she makes out.
TURLOUGH: Dead?!
KANCH: Hope not.
KANCH: enough to
TURLOUGH: Tegan, do
TURLOUGH: I... see.
TEGAN: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 70
TEGAN: (FX: LOCKS AND LOADS) Be as quick as I can. But long enjoy it. (FX: EXITS)
TEGAN: you mean that the Doctor, Nyssa...?
TEGAN: They’1l never see their native Earth again.
TEGAN: That’s why I’m wearing this... special coat of mourning. Brave heart, Turlough.
TURLOUGH: (PLAYING ALONG, SAD) Yes, of course. Thank you.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 71
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: THINGS SHAKING, DEBRIS FALLING, ICE BURSTS IN THE CATACOMBS AS BEFORE)
NYSSA: Doctor, these tunnels are going to shake themselves apart.
DOCTOR: Not only shaking. (FX: TRICKLING WATER) Feel the ice here.
NYSSA: It’s melting! The man in the ice — you can see him!
DOCTOR: The power must be increasing. But power from where, what’s causing this?
MORASS: (PAINED, HOARSE) Morass. Absorbing. Invaders. Absorbing. Morass.
NYSSA: The ice all around him. It’s boiling away. Doctor, we must try to help.
DOCTOR: Let me see. (PUSHES FORWARD) The ice isn’t only boiling around him. It’s boiling out of him.
NYSSA: The ice was inside his body?
DOCTOR: Sustaining him, somehow...
DOCTOR: (FX: MAN’S BODY FALLS WITH WET THUD. DOCTOR AND NYSSA CROUCH TO SEE )
NYSSA: Well, it’s not sustaining him any more. Poor creature, he’s dead.
DOCTOR: And already rotting. (STRAIGHTENS) This chamber holding him in the ice-wall. What do you make of it?
DOCTOR: NYSSA3: Are those... wires at the back?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 72
DOCTOR: Connectors of some kind.
DOCTOR: I wonder... if I just reach out and... [‘touch them —‘]
DOCTOR: NYSSA3: Doctor!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 73
HOSS: Well, while we wait for Kanch to get back, Rennol — what’s been happening?
RENNOL: Turlough claims to have found the circuit that’s drawing off power and blocking our entry.
TEGAN: Entry to what?
TURLOUGH: A dimensional vault. Like an invisible pocket in reality.
TEGAN: Is that why they kidnapped you — to open the door to this vault thing?
TURLOUGH: They think there’s some great treasure hidden inside.
HOSS: We'll be seeing what’s hidden inside your friend’s skull if you don’t get a shift on. And won’t that make a mess of her ‘coat of mourning’?
TURLOUGH: I’ve told Rennol, there’s a metal plate obstructing the lattice. I can’t move it. (HE STRAINS AGAIN) See?
RENNOL: All right, step away. Now Hoss is here, I'll try.
HOSS: No, Rennol. First, let the girl have a go. In case Turlough thought to spring a trap on the next person who volunteered. (PUSHES HER) Go on.
TURLOUGH: It’s all right, Tegan.
TEGAN: I’m just glad I’m wearing this big old coat...
RENNOL: What are you..? She’s up to something!
TEGAN: Think there’s something up my sleeve? Well, I hate to disappoint you... (FLOURISHING METAL BAR) .. but you’re right!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 74
RENNOL: It’s only a metal bar.
HOSS: No. It’s the generator tube from a gravity well.
TEGAN: And I’1l use it if I have to. (FX: WHACKS METAL BAR AGAINST WALL — CLANG)
RENNOL: Don’t! If you discharge a high gravity field you’1ll smear us all over the wall!
TEGAN: I will..? (HIDES SURPRISE AND HARDENS) I will. Should’ve searched me when you found me, Hoss, shouldn’t you?
HOSS: I don’t think you know how to use that thing.
TEGAN: I know how to use it on your precious door controls. So put down your guns. (BEAT) I mean it — (EFFORT)
TURLOUGH: Tegan, no!
DEELA: They’1l kill us!
DEELA: (FX: TEGAN SMASHES CONTROLS WITH METAL ROD — SPUTTERINGS
UNDER: )
RENNOL: You — you’ve destroyed the circuit interface!
TEGAN: I warned you. Put down your guns. NOW!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 75
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: FADE UP. SOMETHING IS TRUDGING DOWN THE PASSAGE TOWARDS
NYSSA: THE MORASS )
NYSSA: (PATTING UNCONSCIOUS DOCTOR’S FACE) Wake up, Doctor. Doctor, wake up!
MORASS: (APPROACHING FROM OFF) Invader.
NYSSA: Doctor, please. You received a shock, but now I really need you
NYSSA: to wake up!
DOCTOR: (GROGGY) Nyssa... What...?
NYSSA: There’s something coming towards us!
MORASS: (CLOSER NOW) Poor creature...
NYSSA: Who are you? What are you?
MORASS: Poor creature, you have been absorbed...
NYSSA: Please. We don’t mean you any harm —
MORASS: (TRIUMPHANT) You have been absorbed... into the Morass!
MORASS: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 76

39. INT. CATACOMBS
FX: POWER DRAINING NOISE
(VOICE SLURS) Function error. Power flow interrupted. Compensate. Treasure must be saved. (REPEAT, SLOWING, THROUGH: )
Doctor, snap out of it. Doctor! I can’t carry you, I need you to focus!
(SHAKING SELF) Yes — yes of course, Nyssa. Sorry, I received something of a shock. Synapses all over the place. (VIEWING MORASS) What a fascinating creature. Like a heap of unformed flesh.

FX: MORASS BEGINS TO COME APART, SQUELCHILY
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 77
Yes. Mortal clay, thankfully. —
I’m sorry-?

FX: THEY RETREAT, SPLASHING DOWN TUNNEL. FADE

40. INT. GREAT HALL
Hoss, Rennol — I said, put down your guns. Turlough and Deela are leaving with me.
FX: GUNS DROPPED WITH A CLATTER
Kanch will be back any moment. He’1ll slaughter you.
We’1ll take our chances.
Marvellous.
You don’t have a hope. There’s nowhere to run to.
He’s right. This is pointless.
Quit arguing, Blondie, and take Rennol’s gun.
I don’t want it!
Just do as she says, Deela. You don’t want to get into an
argument with Tegan.
Why? What’s she going to do?
Win!
Then use the generator tube.
Don’t tempt me.
Hoss, don’t [encourage her]
Use it!
BEAT
