HOSS: Rennol, enough of the theories. You’ve got a map, come in here and help me.
RENNOL: (VIA COMMS) You’re breaking up, Hoss. You want the digi-map of the tunnels? I don’t have it as a separate file, it’s part of a data bundle. I’1l send it over.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 103
HOSS: You can’t just... (FX: TWO LASER BLASTS) Rennol, I need back-up!
RENNOL: (INTO COMMS) I can’t hear what you’re saying, Hoss. Rennol out.
RENNOL: (TO SELF) Contract terminated. One more expense eliminated, and I didn’t have to lift a finger.
RENNOL: (FX: CROSSES THE ROOM — AND A GENTLE PULSATING HUM GROWS IN VOLUME )
RENNOL: (TO SELF) .. Not even to fix the circuit. (SIGHS) You’d better be taking good care of Deela, Turlough. When you get back here... everything will be mine for the taking.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 104
DEELA: I wonder what’s taking Turlough.
TEGAN: He'll be back. He’s got more guts than I give him credit for, that boy.
DEELA: Yes. When his own skin’s at stake.
TEGAN: Bit harsh, isn’t it?
DEELA: Probably. He’s changed since I knew him, though. Distant. Wary. He used to be so... (CATCHES HERSELF) Oh, it doesn’t matter.
TEGAN: You’ve known him a long time?
DEELA: All my life. (PAUSE) You and Turlough. Are you...?
TEGAN: What? No way. But... you two look like you’ve got something going on.
DEELA: I always looked up to him. I thought he was incredible. So clever. Such an attitude. We grew closer as our fathers grew apart. He never cared about any of that grown-up stuff. I did, I tried to hide it, but... Well. When we were in our Bubble, none of that mattered. We were safe. Shut off from everything.
TEGAN: Your Bubble — that thing Hoss and Rennol want open?
DEELA: I want it open. Turlough fixed it so that when we kissed, there it was. Our safe haven. Just ours. (BEAT) I want to go back. Back to how things were.
TEGAN: Hiding away from the world only makes it that much harder when you go back. And you always have to go back.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 105
DEELA: I always thought if I had him, I’d feel happy. But we always want more, don’t we? Never happy with how things are until they change. (SIGHS) You’re right. It can never be like it was. Not now.
TEGAN: Life goes on, Deela. You make what you can of it. And when it stops being fun.. you make it something else.
DEELA: Is this the fun part?
TEGAN: This? (SIGHS) This is definitely something else.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 106
TURLOUGH: (APPROACHING) Where did you leave him?
NYSSA: (APPROACHING) It was somewhere just along here... (SEES DOCTOR IN ICE) Oh no. Look!
TURLOUGH: Doctor? How did this ice form around him so fast?
NYSSA: I told you, it’s not just ice.
TURLOUGH: How do we get him out?
DOCTOR: (MUFFLED BY ICE) With difficulty.
TURLOUGH: He can hear us!
DOCTOR: (MUFFLED BY ICE) Turlough. You’re here. You must reach into the ice.
TURLOUGH: And do what?
DOCTOR: (MUFFLED BY ICE) There’s a knot of ice crystals, above my head. The crystals are ganglia. Still growing. A kind of mind... growing into my own.
DOCTOR: NYSSA3: I believe him.
TURLOUGH: It might not be the Doctor talking. We know these things have taken his form as well as yours.
NYSSA: I said, I believe him.
DOCTOR: (MUFFLED BY ICE) Both of you... It will take both. Please — you must reach in.
TURLOUGH: If you’re wrong, Nyssa...
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 107
DOCTOR: (MUFFLED BY ICE) Quickly!
NYSSA: After three, Turlough. One... two...
TURLOUGH: Three!
TURLOUGH: (FX: FINGERS PENETRATING HALF-FORMED ICE. SLUDGY, CRACKLING WITH ENERGY )
TURLOUGH: (FEELING) Above his head... there is something there.
NYSSA: I can’t get to it. The ice, it’s too solid.
TURLOUGH: No, no. It’s giving way...
NYSSA: My hands. They’re burning...
TURLOUGH: Mine too. Quickly!
DOCTOR: (MUFFLED BY ICE) You must pull out the ganglia. Pull!
TURLOUGH: I can feel it!
TURLOUGH: NYSSA3: It’s horrible...!
TURLOUGH: I’ve got it!
NYSSA: Then pull!
NYSSA: (FX: THEY YANK OUT THE GANGLIA — SQUELCHES, POWER DRAIN — THEN ICE SHATTERS )
DOCTOR: NYSSA3: Doctor!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 108
TURLOUGH: The ice, it’s boiling around him.
NYSSA: The connections are decaying. Destroying the ganglia must have severed the binding force.
DOCTOR: (RECOVERING) Thank you. Turlough, are you all right?
TURLOUGH: I’m feeling better than you look, at any rate.
DOCTOR: Yes, well. I’m a little wiser for my bonding experience with the Morass system — but it’1ll be desperate for a new power
DOCTOR: supply.
NYSSA: Desperate? How can the system be desperate?
DOCTOR: When it’s a living machine. Damaged. Senile. Deranged.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 109
HOSS: Now what?
KANCH: (OFF) Hoss? Is that you, Hoss?
HOSS: Kanch, about time you woke up, get out from that stuff.
KANCH: I’m trying. (FX: SQUELCH) What clobbered me?
HOSS: I don’t know. Same thing as I shot down before, only hundreds of them — and more with the face of the boy’s friend...
KANCH: Where’d they go?
HOSS: I don’t know. There was a sound like something powering down. My gun’s charge pack must be on its last legs, too. We need to find your blaster and clear out. So get off your knees and start — [shifting]
KANCH: I — I can’t, Hoss.
HOSS: Come on, take hold of my — [hand]
KANCH: It won’t let me go.
HOSS: It’s just sludge, slush.
KANCH: It’s not. It’s moving. Agh! It’s biting!
HOSS: Take my hand, come on —
HOSS: (FX: KANCH CRIES OUT AS THE SLUSH PULLS HIM AWAY WITH A VIOLENT JERK — HEAVY DRAGGING NOISE)
KANCH: Hoss! It’s taking me!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 110
HOSS: No! (FX: FIRES LASERS) Let go of him! Bring him back. Bring him back!
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 111
TEGAN: Deela... do you hear that?
DEELA: Those things again..? No, I can’t take it.
DEELA: (DEELA TRIES TO RUN BUT TEGAN HOLDS ONTO HER HAND WITH SOME DIFFICULTY )
TEGAN: (STRUGGLING) You can’t just run off, Deela.
DEELA: Let go of my hand!
TEGAN: Calm down. If you run blindly, who knows what you’1ll run into —
DOCTOR: (APPROACHING) Tegan!
TEGAN: Doctor! It’s all right, Deela — look who’s made it!
DOCTOR: (AUDIBLY WEAKENED) Just about.
TEGAN: You look terrible.
NYSSA: We barely got the Doctor free in time.
TURLOUGH: Deela, are you all right?
DEELA: Just scared. I— I’m fine now.
TEGAN: (KNOWING) Now Turlough’s here.
TURLOUGH: Doctor — this is Deela, a friend. Kidnapped like I was.
DOCTOR: How do you do. Tell me — why were you brought here?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 112
TEGAN: It’s Turlough’s palace.
DOCTOR: (SURPRISED) Yours?!?
TURLOUGH: Not really. It belonged to my family, once.
DEELA: A man called Rennol needs us both here together to unlock some treasure.
DOCTOR: What treasure?
TURLOUGH: We don’t know what. Apparently it’s held in a dimensional vault.
DOCTOR: Yes of course. The treasure house...
DOCTOR: NYSSA3: Treasure house?
DOCTOR: That’s how the Morass thinks of it. It’s connected to it through the ice crystals growing out of — and into — the rock.
TEGAN: What’s this Morass?
DOCTOR: A sentient security system installed centuries ago to defend that treasure — and in so doing, the planet.
TEGAN: Then that’s the reason no-one else lives here — the Morass won’t let them?
DEELA: It fits...
DEELA: NYSSA3: What fits?
DEELA: Nothing. Just something my father thought.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 113
DOCTOR: In any case, when we crash-landed here the gravity wells sent force-energy down through the planet’s crust — enough to activate the Morass and put it on a war footing.
TEGAN: It thought we were attacking?
DOCTOR: Seems it can’t distinguish between an accidental impact and a true bombardment. Not any more. Somehow the nature of the treasure-house was altered a long time ago — and the Morass was damaged in the process...
TURLOUGH: (TO SELF) My great-grandfather, installing the DNA match...
DOCTOR: (HASN'T HEARD) It’s confused. Crazed by pain and age. It has to be shut down before it can find another energy source.
DOCTOR: (FX: DISTANT DRAGGING NOISE — THE MORASS ON THE MOVE. CONTINUES
THROUGH: )
TEGAN: Shh. Listen.
NYSSA: The Morass, it has to be.
TURLOUGH: Where’s Deela?
TEGAN: She was here a moment ago. But then she was ready to split by herself just before you got back.
TURLOUGH: I’d better go after her.
DOCTOR: We’ll all go. (GETS UP AND GASPS)
TEGAN: Doctor, you’re still too weak. I’1l1 help you.
NYSSA: I’1l go on ahead with Turlough.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 114
TURLOUGH: Come on then. If you’re coming.
DOCTOR: (CALLS) Be careful.
DOCTOR: (FX: DISTANT SCRAPING, SQUELCHING OF MORASS GETTING SLOWLY CLOSER)
TEGAN: That thing’s getting closer. Come on, Doctor. I’ve got you.
HOSS: (STEPPING IN, FROM LEFT) I think you’1ll find that I’ve got you.
TEGAN: Hoss!
HOSS: You didn’t think I’d catch you up?
DOCTOR: Please. The gun isn’t necessary.
HOSS: Yes it is. There’s a shapeless, crawling thing coming this way. It’s got Kanch. And maybe if I feed it one of you, it’1ll give him back.
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 115
RENNOL: Who’s there? (PAUSE) Hoss, is that you?
DEELA: (ARRIVED) It’s all right. It’s me.
RENNOL: Deela! What’s been happening...? You’re alone?
DEELA: All alone. Just you and me. Oh, Rennol.
RENNOL: You and me, sweetest.
DEELA: Alone at last.
DEELA: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 116

elements.text: PART FOUR
Deela! What’s been happening...? You’re alone?
All alone. Just you and me. Oh, Rennol.
FX: SHE RUNS TO HIM
You and me, sweetest.
Alone at last.
FX: THEY KISS
CONTINUES INTO:
60. INT. GREAT HALL
(BREAKING OFF KISS) Deela, I spoke to Hoss. The security system had got Kanch. She was trapped. I was so worried.
About me — or the plan?
We’ve put so much into this. If Kanch and Hoss are dead, that only makes cheating them easier. But what about Turlough — is he safe?
(ANXIOUS) I hope so.
Oh?
(RECOVERING) For the sake of the plan. He’s back with his friends now...
They weren’t dead?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 117

By now, who knows? I tried to talk Turlough out of going. Then I dropped my scarf by the hidden door for Hoss and Kanch to find — but when I saw they couldn’t get me out... I didn’t know what to do. So I came to find you. Oh, it’s so horrible in there. The security system, it’s so.. so alien. Evil.
You should’ve stuck with Turlough. If he dies in there...
He can’t... He mustn’t.
(SLOWLY) For the sake of the plan.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 118
61. INT. YET MORE CATACOMBS
(TO STOP) Turlough, wait. (BEAT) I thought I heard something?
The Morass could be coming to life any moment. We need to move.
THEY SET OFF AGAIN
Why did you come with me?
No-one should have to go through these tunnels alone.
I thought perhaps Tegan had... told you things. About what happened after you left us. I thought you didn’t trust me.
All of that was a long time ago for me. I trust you, Turlough. I think I always did.
(AFFECTED) Yes, well. Trust is one thing. To rely on me, another.
Why do you think Deela ran?
She was terrified. She hasn’t seen much away from her own system.. (SIGHS) My world went to war with itself. I was forced to participate in that war.
You must have seen some terrible things.

My mother was killed. My father and brother were forced to run who-knows-where. I was the lucky one. An exile on a backward planet. But Deela was spared all that. Her father was on the ‘right’ side. He was always so protective. Smothering... (STOPS HIMSELF) This tunnel leads back to the palace. Deela knows where she’s going.
And this Rennol will be waiting...
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 119
62. INT. ELSEWHERE IN CATACOMBS
For heaven’s sake, Hoss, we need to be working together!
You’1ll do as I say.
Perhaps we should get to know each other a little, check who’s really best qualified to give the orders. I’m the Doctor, I’ma Time Lord — this is Tegan, from Earth...
You think this is funny?

Not at all. But you seem to think this situation is something you can solve with a gun — and it’s not. I can assure you the Morass won’t accept one of us in place of Kanch. It doesn’t judge us as individuals — we simply represent a threat to the treasure it’s protecting.
And how would you know so much?
Because he’s been a part of it.
It wanted my life energy as a power supply. Just as it now wants Kanch to take my place.
Then they’ve taken him because of you. It’s your fault.

Oh yes, splendid reasoning! It’s our fault for coming after Turlough when you abducted him. Our fault that the ship that took us here was too easy a target for your murderous friend. Our fault you forced us into a crash-landing and instigated this whole chain of events!
You got away from it. We can get Kanch away from it too.
No. The Morass learns, even in its decrepit condition; it scans and absorbs. It will have analysed the way I was released and it won’t let it happen again.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 120
Quiet — it’s coming!
Backs to the wall.
FX: SQUELCHING, CHUCKLING MORASS RASPS PAST
(SOTTO) Kanch. I see Kanch, in the body of that thing!
(SOTTO) It’s smothered him. He’s been absorbed.
(SOTTO) It’s horrible. Like — I don’t know, jelly!
(SOTTO) That’s the raw stuff of the Morass.
FX: BY NOW, MORASS HAS MOVED PAST THEM
It’s OK, it’s gone. (STEPPING AWAY FROM WALL) So you’re telling me that’s the same stuff those facsimiles were made of?
The Morass can scan the enemy and create duplicates in these alcoves. It sends them into the enemy ranks to create confusion and delay.
But Hoss was shooting them down like fish in a barrel.
They dissolve, go to pieces with a single blast. If we go after it, find its weak spot and attack again...
Don’t you listen? The Morass needs energy to function — it wanted you to fire at it. It absorbed the heat and light of your laser blasts. How much did you give it?
I.. I gave it the entire power pack. (FX: SHE DROPS THE GUN TO THE ICE) The gun’s empty.
That’s a lot of power, right?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 121

When the Morass bonds with Kanch and uses him as an energy source, there’ll be nothing to stop it converting all that heat and light into strength. When it reforms the facsimiles they’1l be a hundred times more powerful.
And we’ve got no way to defend ourselves. No way at all!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 122
63. INT. PALACE: CORRIDOR/GREAT HALL
(OFF, THROUGH DOORS) You realise one of us will have to go into the catacombs to find Turlough.
(OFF, THROUGH DOORS) Don’t make me go back, Rennol.
[RENNOL: (OFF, THROUGH DOORS) Don’t go to pieces, Deela. There’s too much at stake. ]
[DEELA: (OFF, THROUGH DOORS) I... I must just rest first. ]
[RENNOL: (OFF, THROUGH DOORS) Rest later. Business now. ]
FX: MEANWHILE, NYSSA AND TURLOUGH ARE CREEPING ALONG CORRIDOR
(STOPPING, LOW) Nyssa, listen. That’s Deela. Rennol’s got her.
(LOW) If we can only talk to him, convince him we’re all in danger...
(LOW) He won’t listen. And he’s armed. Perhaps we should be too.
(LOW) I don’t follow.
(LOW) Look. Mounted on the wall.
(LOW) A ceremonial scabbard?! And what has Rennol got?
(LOW) Some sort of laser pistol. But if we push over the suit of armour outside the doors here, Rennol will come to investigate and then...
(LOW) You whack him with the scabbard.
LOW) Well, it’s a plan, isn’t it? (BEAT) Ready? (DEEP BREATH
Deep breath, and — PUSH!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 123
FX: THEY HEAVE OVER THE ARMOUR. CRASH-CLANNNG!
FX: CROSS TO:
What was that?
I.. I’11 go and see. (FX: FOLLOW HIM AS HE CROSSES TO DOOR) It could be Hoss or —
(HEFTYING SCABBARD) .. or me!
Turl—[aaaah!] (FX: TURLOUGH CLOBBERS HIM WITH SCABBARD, PISTOL DROPS)
(RUNNING FORWARD; SEES) You?!?
Are you all right, Deela?
GROANS
Rennol’s not out. Deela, get his gun.
Of course. (SCOOPS IT UP)
(GROGGY) Deel1a...?
(PASSING GUN) Here. You dropped your pistol.
3: Deela!
I don’t understand. —
Thank you, Deela. (GETTING UP) Don’t move, either of you. I will use this if I have to.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 124
Deela, you gave him his gun back, are you mad? (NO ANSWER) Deela?
Oh, she’s mad alright, Turlough. Mad about me.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 125
64. INT. CATACOMBS

Tegan, Hoss — we must get after Turlough. We need his knowledge of the tunnel layout. There must be a physical link between the Morass and this treasure it safeguards — a confluence of the power supply, the junction of this world and the Palace above. If we can find a way to uncouple them, the Morass will lose its purpose.
You mean with nothing to protect, it’1ll stop fighting?
I hope so.
Can’t we just leave in the flyers, like Turlough said?
We can’t just abandon Kanch, whatever he’s done.
You’re serious?
He’s the Doctor. (SIGHS) OK — so how do we find this ‘junction of worlds’ place?
You say you were a part of that thing, don’t you know?
It’s like a dream — slipping away.
Well, you don’t need the boy. I’ve got a map.
Show me.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 126
65. INT. GREAT HALL
How could you, Deela?
Don’t judge me, Nyssa. You don’t know what I’ve been through.
I do, and I’m still judging you. You and Rennol.. you’re actually together?
Vizz—
Tell me!
We don’t have to tell you anything.
No. You should know. Rennol and me, we’re getting married. I... never thought I’d see you again, Vizz, and when I met Rennol..
You sound like you’re apologising!
I’m explaining. My father took against Rennol.
A rare lapse of bad taste.
He tried to block the engagement. Froze my credit accounts, blocked all assets...
So you looked elsewhere for your dowry. And knew you’d have to trick the only idiot who could help you get it.
I.. Please, I know it looks bad, but — [really]
(BITTER) But what? You suddenly realize you’ve made a terrible mistake? That it was me you wanted all along? That a teenage infatuation is worth more than money?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 127
All right, enough of this. Deela, if these two got out of the catacombs, so can their friends. We don’t want to be outnumbered. Get back to the hidden entrance. Barricade it.
If you seal them inside you’1ll be killing them!
Do it, Deela. And quickly.
Why me?
(SARDONIC) How can you watch Turlough when you can’t even look him in the eye?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 128
66. INT. CATACOMBS
How did you come by this map, Hoss?
Rennol uploaded it to my comms-band.
FX: BLEEP OF COMMS — AND SUSTAINED HUM OF TRANSMISSION
Pictures in the air? That’s amazing.
Where did you find this woman?
Er.. this doesn’t look like a map of the catacombs.
It’s part of a data bundle. Rennol sent me through a whole packet of — [things]
. Wait. What is that?
Oh. Wiring diagram. Rennol said it was to do with the dimensional vault, but Turlough didn’t recognise it.
Can you bring up the catacombs map as an overlay?
I suppose.
FX: HOSS FLICKS THROUGH DATA
Is it just me, or does that section look exactly the same?
Yes. The junction of worlds.
That’s the join we need to break?
If we’re to sever the link between the Morass and the treasure it protects. Now, let me just work out the safest route...
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 129
67. INT. GREAT HALL
Turlough, when Deela returns, I hope you’1l be reasonable. Time is against us. If you co-operate, just open the door to the Bubble — [and]
It’s not “the Bubble” anymore. It’s just an empty space. A vault that’s been shut down.
Open it up, and we can all share the treasure!
What is this treasure, Rennol? Do you even know?
He knows. Because Deela’s father knows — that’s where he got his “intelligence” on this place.

Your ancestor was an ambassador to alien worlds — and a member of the Royal Court. By the time the Arar-Jecks had fought their way to Trion borders, he’d done a deal with various neutral powers, to give hin...
. “special protection”?
Exactly. He offered the vault as a hiding place for the Trion queen in case of attack or invasion. The entire regal entourage could shelter inside, leaving no heat traces, no life signs. Nothing.
(INTRIGUED DESPITE HIMSELF) Vanishing clean off the enemy’s radar...
So the invaders would deduce that the palace was empty, and the world deserted, and leave again.
Or if they didn’t, the Morass — the security system in the catacombs — would activate. Programmed to kill all invaders and protect the people inside the vault.
Buying them time to get off the planet.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 130

The point is, Deela’s father found papers claiming that the Queen did hide here with her entourage. That they took certain treasures in with them, too. Treasures that the old ambassador agreed to store there in case of future incursions.
But there’s nothing there!
Think about it, Turlough. Your great-grandfather was a smuggler — by definition, a master of secret compartments.
Why not hide one within another?
Imagine, Turlough — the lost treasure hoard of the old Trion royals... What if it’s been there all this time?
I see now why Deela’s father was so keen to ‘protect’ the palace. If he waits till the end of the war, I come back from exile, he puts me and Deela together here — and then he can pocket the lot.
He’1ll get nothing. Wait ‘til Deela gets back — then you’1ll see.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 131
68. INT. CATACOMBS
FX: DIGI-MAP STILL ACTIVE, AS BEFORE
Doctor, you must have worked out a safe path by now.
There is no safe path! But if I could only concentrate, I might be able to discern a route that’s slightly less lethal than all the others...
Leaving me to make polite conversation with the kidnapping reptile I brained a couple of hours back. Awkward, isn’t it?
I’m a mercenary. Shifting allegiances goes with the territory.
I’m not sure that goes with the territory.
What doesn’t?
There, by your feet. Some miniature gizmo. Didn’t see it till it caught the light from that map thing.
(STOOPS TO PICK UP) Looks to be a sub-space transmitter.
For communicating? It’s so small.
(FX: SMALL BLIP) There’s only one call sign in the memory.
Whose?
Let’s find out.
(FX: COMMS ACTIVATES — SHOULD MATCH NOISE OF RENNOL’S COMMUNICATOR IN SCENE 3)
Hello? (PAUSE) Hello?
RENNOL [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED, AS DEELA’S WAS]: Deela? What’s keeping you?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL)
They’re asking for Deela?! That thing must be hers.
RENNOL [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: Deela? What’s wrong?
(QUIETLY) That’s Rennol. It’s got to be.
What?
(INTO COMMS) Rennol?
FX: STRAIGHT CUT TO RENNOL IN GREAT HALL:
Page 132
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 133
69. INT. GREAT HALL
(VOICE NO LONGER DISGUISED, OF COURSE) Deela? Who is this?
HOSS [SYNTHETICALLY DISGUISED]: (VOICE DISGUISED) Who’d you think? (FX: BLEEP! AND HOSS’S VOICE IS NORMAL) I’m taking the signal off scrambler. Does that help?
Hoss!
I warned you what would happen if you tried to play me, Rennol.
That was careless of you, Rennol.
(GLOATS) Very careless.
(TROUBLED) Shut up.
FX: RUSH OF FOOTSTEPS AS DEELA ENTERS FROM CORRIDOR
All right, I pushed a big display case in front of the entrance to the catacombs, that ought — [to keep them inside]
You little idiot!
What? (BEAT) It’s a really heavy one.
I hope so. Because if Hoss gets out you’1l be killed right here. You dropped the comms-link!
What...? (FEELS FOR IT) It was fixed to my arm, hidden by my sleeve. It must’ve come loose.
Obviously! She called me. I thought it was you. I thought she must be dead.
We’1ll all be dead if we don’t help the Doctor stop the Morass!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 134
70. INT. CATACOMBS
I don’t understand — I thought Rennol kidnapped Deela, held her prisoner.

“Locked up” on a ship — with a direct link on scrambler so she could speak to him whenever, even in confinement. He must've worked out I had a tap on his regular comms band, so he used another to talk to her. I knew he was pulling something.
But why bother to trick you? Rennol and Deela could have hired you together?

Isn’t it obvious? They wanted us to think Deela was a spineless brat, no threat — so they could cheat us once we’d got the treasure. Plus, your friend Turlough might have seen through her act, if we’d all been in on the game. Too clever for his own good, that one.

BEAT

Ruined...!

From the way this one’s dressed... and the hole in the ribcage... I’d say this one used to be my smuggling great-grandfather.

76. INT. GREAT HALL
(FX: SIZZLES AS DOCTOR, TURLOUGH, NYSSA, DEELA AND RENNOL EXIT THE BUBBLE)
(RE-ENTERING HALL) Turlough, Deela, I need that Vault deactivated.

No! Nobody move!
Rennol, you heard the Doctor.
Put down the gun, Rennol. I need to see the Vault controls.
(CRACKING) I put the last of my money into setting all this up. Hired spaceships, mercenaries...

Arrgh!
FX: CRASHES TO GROUND

(FX: RUSHING OVER) Rennol? (CHECKS) He’s out cold. How did he jerk through the air like that?
That was me. And this — generator tube, I think. It was on the floor.

Good, good. Now! (EXAMINING VAULT CONTROLS) The Vault controls...

This lash-up isn’t fully compatible. It’s left the Morass’s command cortex riddled with function errors.
It’s been slowly driven insane. It can’t listen to anyone.
We didn’t know... how could we have known?
I need to get to work. Turlough, Deela, I need you to shut down the Vault — if you wouldn’t mind...?
(TURLOUGH AND DEELA PERFORM A PERFUNCTORY KISS. INVERSE ACTIVATION FX AS VAULT POWERS DOWN)
Thank you.
VizZz...
Don’t touch me.
You've got to believe me, since seeing you again...
Don’t.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 148
(FX: FROM CORRIDOR, WE HEAR THE APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS, REPEATED PHRASES OF FACSIMILES, AS BEFORE)
Listen. The Morass is coming.
(SHUDDERS) So many...
Turlough, Deela, stand in the doorway. The facsimiles won’t try to hurt you. Nyssa, you must use the generator tube to keep them out until I can finish rewiring the system.
But the generator’s almost out of power.
It’s all we’ve got! Now, where’s Rennol’s communicator...?
(PASSING COMMUNICATOR) Here.
Thank you. (FX: BLEEP!)
FX: CUT TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 149
77. INT. POWER JUNCTION
(FX: MORASS FACSIMILES APPROACHING IN B/G, REPEATED PHRASES AS BEFORE )
(VIA COMMS) Tegan? Are you receiving me?
(INTO COMMS) Doctor, thank heavens. The Morass is on to us. Dozens of those dead-eyed monsters. They’ve got us trapped!
FX: CUT BACK TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 150
78: INT. GREAT HALL
(INTO COMMS) Stand by, Tegan. Won’t be long now. Doctor out. (FX: COMMS BLEEP) (MUTTERS) Not enough time, not nearly enough.
Doctor? What are you going to do?
Disconnect the dimensional vault from the security circuit, so the Morass has nothing to guard — and therefore no further purpose.

(TO MORASS) You know me! Back! Get back-!!!

(RUNNING OVER TO WINDOW) Don’t worry, I’ve still got the generator tube —
FX: BLAP! AND MORASS SQUELCH

(WORKING FRANTICALLY AT CONTROLS) The circuit’s not responding. Oh, for my sonic screwdriver...

(VIA COMMS) Doctor? What’s keeping you?!?
(INTO COMMS) Tegan, keep standing by.
DEELAs: Can’t we all hide in the Bubble?
(WORKING) I can’t reopen it until I’ve finished the rewiring. And we can hardly abandon Tegan and Hoss.
This generator tube’s almost completely drained.

(GETTING UP) Then again — there’s more than one way to leave the planet.

Please, Deela. You and Turlough would be sacrificing yourselves for the greater good.
Deela, come back here with me, he means it. He’1ll kill you.
(STILL WORKING) Rennol, don’t be a fool. I must complete the severance. You’re wasting everyone’s time.
You can’t help us! You only talk!
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL)
FX: ANOTHER WINDOW SHATTERS. MORE FACSIMILES
3: More of them!
Then use the tube!!!
Power’s dead, sorry.
(FRANTIC WORK) Nearly there...
Rennol, please — point the gun at the
Deela. Sweet Deela. If you just leave
You won’t fire. You wouldn’t hurt me...
FX: PISTOL BLAST
CRIES OUT AS SHE’S HIT
Deela!!
DEELA SLUMPS TO FLOOR
Rennol, what have you — [done]
. Done it! (INTO COMMS) Tegan, Hoss —
FX: CUT TO:
Morass, not us!
this world...
I know you...
Page 152
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 153
79. INT. POWER JUNCTION
FX: CLAMOUR OF FACSIMILES
(VIA COMMS) .. put the scrambler unit up against the fronds in

Finally.
You heard the man. Switch on!
FX: HIGH PITCHED SCRAMBLED WHINE. HARD CUT TO:
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 154
80. INT. GREAT HALL
FX: FACSIMILES GROANING, OFF
(DYING) Vizz? Are you there, Vizz?
Rennol! Give me the gun... It’s over.
I’m here, Deela. Nyssa, help me!

No! The Morass, it’s still coming! We’ve got to kill the boy too, don’t you see?!?
(DYING) Can we go back, Vizz? Back to our bubble...?
TENDER) Let’s see. (HE KISSES HER
FX: VAULT ACTIVATES TO ONE SIDE

It’s safe in there. It’s safe!!! (BOLTS FOR IT)
No, Rennol! Don’t go in, you don’t understand—!
FX: SIZZLE AS RENNOL ENTERS VAULT
(SLIGHTLY OFF, SLIGHTLY MUFFLED) Safe!!! I’m safe-!!!
FX: A CRACKLING POWER SURGE FROM VAULT
SCREAMS...
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 155
FX: .. CUT OFF SUDDENLY BY VAULT ‘CLOSING’
(FX: MORASS RASPS ITS LAST. ITS FACSIMILES FALL APART, AS EARLIER)
BEAT. THE SILENCE SHOULD BE RINGING — A FEW SECONDS
Deela. Stay with me. Deela!!!
I’m sorry, Turlough.
So sorry.
(HOARSE) Sorry? (THEN HARDER) Why are you sorry? She’s dead, isn’t she?
FX: COMMS CRACKLE INTO LIFE
(VIA COMMS) Doctor? Are you there? It’s all gone quiet down here.
(VIA COMMS) The facsimiles have melted to slush. Now what about Kanch?
(INTO COMMS) Hoss, Tegan, wait there. I’1ll come to get you — then we can try to revive Kanch.
Try? But the Morass is dead. Kanch will be all right...?
I.. There may be some ill-effects.
I was after a change of career... (SNORTS) Nursemaid wasn’t exactly what I had in mind. (BEAT) Hoss out.
FX: COMMS BEEP OFF
Doctor. You managed to sever the power link between the vault and the catacombs?
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 156
I reversed it. Routed the Morass’s power supply into the vault and switched the Vault to encompass Kanch instead — isolating him from the system.
The Morass couldn’t cope with disruption on that scale?
So it would seem.

Rennol supplied it just by running inside.

Yes. I, er — I’d better find Tegan and Hoss. (HE LEAVES. )
What do you think, Nyssa? Is Rennol dead? Or is he still trapped inside?
I hope he’s dead.
I don’t.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 157
81. EXT. PALACE GROUNDS
(FX: FADE UP. FROM OFF, HOSS’S SPACESHIP LAUNCHING, AS IN PART ONE )
Ah, Tegan. There go Hoss and Kanch.
Good riddance.
Oh, I don’t know. Experiences like they’ve had today can change people.
Well, I don’t think Kanch will ever be the same again. Which can only be an improvement.
(REPROVING) Tegan!
All right. Just so long as they don’t go back to Vektris for their rest cure. (BEAT) Can we get going now?
Yes. The TARDIS interior should have stablised. Although I rather think the console needs a complete overhaul...
I know how it feels.
Well, I’d better familiarise myself with the controls of Rennol’s flyer. (PAUSE) Will Turlough be joining us, do you think?
Nyssa’s gone to see.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 158
82. INT. PALACE: GREAT HALL
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) Turlough? We’1ll be going soon.
Will we... (PAUSE) You know, Deela and I used to lie in that vault and talk about the future. Dreaming what we’d do when we got away. When we were free.
NYSSA SITS BESIDE HIM

Now that I’m older, I don’t like to talk about the future so much. But I still dream about it. (PAUSE) I have another life now, Turlough. People I’m close to, who are waiting for me. And yet here I am.. back travelling. Back being free.

Not quite. And you can’t turn back the clock, not even with the Doctor. But there’s always another future out there, Turlough — that’s what the Doctor gives us. Hope for the future, when you’re ready to find it.
SHE GETS UP
By the way... the Doctor doesn’t know anything about your old life on Trion. And Tegan won’t tell. You can move on with your secrets safe. Till you choose to share them.
SHE LEAVES. TURLOUGH IS ALONE
I’m never sharing anything. Ever again.
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 159
83. EXT. PALACE GROUNDS
(WALKING UP) Hi, Nyssa. I was just on my way to find you. Is Turlough coming?
I think so. And I think we should let all that’s happened here... remain here.
Freezing over.
Like the catacombs. Like the palace.
Like Turlough.
END OF PART FOUR
KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 160

RENNOL: Deela! What’s been happening...? You’re alone?
DEELA: All alone. Just you and me. Oh, Rennol.
RENNOL: You and me, sweetest.
DEELA: Alone at last.
RENNOL: (BREAKING OFF KISS) Deela, I spoke to Hoss. The security system had got Kanch. She was trapped. I was so worried.
DEELA: About me — or the plan?
RENNOL: We’ve put so much into this. If Kanch and Hoss are dead, that only makes cheating them easier. But what about Turlough — is he safe?
DEELA: (ANXIOUS) I hope so.
RENNOL: Oh?
DEELA: (RECOVERING) For the sake of the plan. He’s back with his friends now...
RENNOL: They weren’t dead?
DOCTOR WHO: KISS OF DEATH by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 117

I didn’t know what to do. So I came to find you. Oh, it’s so horrible in there. The security system, it’s so.. so alien. Evil.

TEGAN: For heaven’s sake, Hoss, we need to be working together!
